campaign.story:
The day has finally come. Your training at Farrador Keep has come to its end. You are now a fully fledged adventurer ready to make your name known in all the lands. However, this time, you will go it alone. Farrador is a relatively peaceful region; however, menacing monsters reside in the shadows of even the brightest lights. You are being called to explore abandoned mines, save villages from devastating foes, and claim your name as the next true adventurer. All this and more will be possible as you go Into the Unknown!
Into the Unknown is a true solo adventure for characters level 1-5 for 5e, B/X, or Swords & Wizardry!
Artwork by Francesca Frisinelli
True solo modules are just that... solo. These books are designed to be played by a single player using the 5th Edition, B/X, or Swords & Wizardry systems. If you have ever read a Pick-a-Path, Choose Your Own Adventure, or Endless Quest book, you will feel right at home with Into the Unknown. These adventure campaigns are designed in that way where you choose your own fate as you decide where to go and what to do while adventuring through Farrador. You play your character and the monsters or encounters in which he or she explores. Gone are the days of wishing for a group to play with! Now your own fate is in your hands.
This book may also be run with one GM and one player. The text will be nearly flawless to play this way; however, the only real difference is the layout of the book does not follow traditional RPG books Pacesetter or other companies use when creating campaigns/modules. It does read like a Choose Your Own Adventure. For example, if you decide to go into the cave mouth, turn to page 23. If you choose to scout around the entrance first, turn to page 24. So on and so forth.
A quick note from, me, the designer and project manager, Ben Barsh:
I could not be more excited to bring this book to life. I have worked on many projects in my small career as designer; however, none have hit the nostalgia cord like this one. I began playing 1st Edition in my late middle school years (2011-ish). Other than small games with my father and at conventions, I was not exposed to a true campaign due to lack of a group. This problem was resolved through solo adventures. 
I immediately played through the first three solo modules my father wrote through Pacesetter. I believe I finished adventuring in 2 days (school got in the way). I sprinted downstairs after my final encounter and begged him for more adventure my 3rd level Ranger, Grimlon, could go on. He dusted off his old TSR solo adventures and off I was on my next great adventure.
Here I am in 2020 having the honor of bringing this module to life. This campaign is truly special to me. I want to thank all of you for visiting this page and potentially backing. You are quite literally making a childhood dream come true.
Artwork by Raven Evermoor
This book will include:
64+ pages of adventure
Full color interior (art and maps)
New Magic Items
New Monsters
And more pending stretch goals!
The adventures you go on will take place in Farrador. This is a region of Dagmore (Ben Barsh's world being developed). This campaign is a sandbox solo story. You make your own decisions as you go, and they will lead you down different paths to the conclusion. As you can see by the map below, there are many areas to explore in Dagmore. Pending your decisions, you may even explore all areas!
Cartography by Raven Evermoor
Adventuring solo is not an ordinary practice for many. It presents a different array of challenges that normal RPGs do not fall victim to. In an effort to quell the fire of uncertainty, Pacesetter has developed our SoloSystem™ that is included in the beginning of every solo module we create. This outlines tips on how to adventure, rules to modify or keep in mind, and recommendations on how to go about mapping, resting, hirelings, experience, death, etc. We also introduce the idea of Adventure Points to help your character overcome great threats!
Your character will start with a new “stat” called Adventure Points (AP). Your PC will have a number of APs equal to their character level: A second level character will start the game with an AP 2. Each time you gain a level, you add an amount of APs equal to your new level. For example, a second level character starts with AP 2. The adventurer advances to third level and gains 3 APs. If your character had not used any APs, they would now have a total of AP 5. APs are not regenerated by rest. When used, they are gone until you gain more by level advancement.
APs are used as a mulligan. If your character failed a specific die roll, they can spend one AP to change the die roll to match the desired/required result. This can be done for saving throws, attack rolls, skill checks, find a secret door, etc. Also, an AP can be used to grant a reroll at any time, such as damage rolls, hit point generation, etc. Furthermore, you can use an AP to alter a described result.
These tips and recommendations will be fitted for each game system. For example, experience does not function the same in 5e, B/X, and S&W, so we will have a section specifically designed for teaching you how to reward yourself experience.

This is the mega pledge of the Kickstarter! See "Hardcover Hero" above for details on the hardcover book. You will also receive the three individual PDFs for each softcover book and the hardcover book PDF.
200 Backers - Poster Map of Farrador! - (Unlocked!)
When the project hits 200 backers, we will print and include a 17x11 folded poster map of Farrador with every book! This is absolutely FREE to all backers at a physical pledge or higher. This can be used while playing so you do not have to flip back and forth between pages or simply put in a frame for you to proudly display for guests!
$3,000 - Pacesetter Character Sheets - (Unlocked!)
This stretch goal is absolutely FREE to all backers who back at least the PDF level. Once we have raised $3,000, we will add our character sheets to the appendix of the book or send them as a separate PDF. The 5th edition sheet was designed by Wonkee (our amazing interior artist and cartographer). They are an amazing addition to any campaign fueled by Pacesetter! The B/X and S&W sheets were designed by our fearless leader Bill Barsh!
There will be a separate character sheet for 5th edition, B/X, and S&W.
$4,000 - More Art! - (Unlocked!)
Once we have raised $4,000, we will add in 2 more interior pieces by the amazingly talented Raven Evermoor! These art pieces will continue to help bring the visual life to the book!
$5,000 - Character Creation Section - (Unlocked!)
This stretch goal is absolutely FREE to all backers who back at least the PDF level. Once we have raised $5,000, we will add character creation charts for your use. These charts will be tailored precisely to the campaign that follows. There will even be recommendations on how to build characters for solo adventure! Your generated character will be ready for the adventure! The following charts will be available for your use: class, race, background, personality traits, flaws, and quirks.
There will be a separate character creation section for 5th edition, B/X, and S&W!
* Note: The listed charts are subject to change before final layout. If you would like to recommend a chart, leave us a comment :) *
$6,000 - More Art! - (Unlocked!)
Once we have raised $6,000, we will add in 2 more interior pieces by the amazingly talented Raven Evermoor! These art pieces will continue to help bring the visual life to the book!
$8,000 - New Subclass! - (Unlocked!)
Once we have raised $8,000, we will publish the Elemental Ranger in the book as a new option for you to play! This is a new subclass of ranger that calls upon four of the natural elements of the world: fire, earth, water, and air. You may now use these forces to amplify attacks, defense, or tactical maneuvering.
This subclass will function more or less the same in each edition this book is being released for. Obviously the mechanics will be different; however, we will stay true to the original abilities and perks for becoming an Elemental Ranger.
The Elemental Ranger is woven into the unique lore of Farrador Keep, a college of sorts for those wishing to become adventurers. This subclass does not specifically given any sort of advantage over other during solo play, but it does give a unique twist that allows you to personalize your ranger more than ever.
This subclass will be available for playtest and review before the books are printed as long as there is interest! If there is interest in this, leave us a comment! If there is enough intriguing minds, we will release these early for you to try out!
$10,000 - More Story! - (Unlocked!)
Once we have raised $10,000, I will write in another story arc for the campaign! As we know, your decisions in pick-a-path/solo adventure style books can take you anywhere. This stretch goal will add in more options of adventure. Think of it like a different branch has been unlocked! This will feature the same color maps and art used in the rest of the book. The adventure will remain levels 1-5, which makes it more re-playable.
$12,000 - Another New Subclass! (Unlocked!)
Once we have raised $12,000, we will publish the Path of the Ruinseeker Barbarian! This new subclass allows barbarians to harness the wild and untapped magic that lies within!
For 5th edition, this is quite simple. You will be able to choose Path of the Ruinseeker as your primal path at third level. This subclass will allow you to access the sorcerer spell list, cast spells while raging, and relentlessly cast allowing yourself to exchange physical exhausting for more spell damage (the latter two being unlocked at higher levels).
For B/X and Swords & Wizardry, we will be introducing the barbarian class as an option of play. Along with that, you will be able to choose to be the Path of the Ruinseeker. This will function similar in each edition allowing your barbarian to be opened to their primal magical nature. 
The Path of the Ruinseeker Barbarian is woven into the unique lore of Farrador Keep, a college of sorts for those wishing to become adventurers. This subclass does not specifically given any sort of advantage over other during solo play, but it does give a unique twist that allows you to personalize your barbarian more than ever.
This subclass will be available for playtest and review before the books are printed as long as there is interest! If there is interest in this, leave us a comment! If there is enough intriguing minds, we will release these early for you to try out!
Art by Francesca Frisinelli
$14,000 - Alternate Ending - (Unlocked!)
Once we have raised $14,000, I will write in an alternate ending for this story! Since the ending will be relatively similar in each playthrough, I would like to add in another for those who are going to play the module more than once. This will also help keep the sandbox nature of the adventure rather than have the ending be on the railroad tracks (an inevitable feature of many RPG books). This ending will be woven into the fabric of the adventure as to keep the sense of the unknown alive!
$22,000 - New Dwarf Playable Subrace - (Unlocked!)
Once we have raised $22,000, we will publish the Bijou Dwarf!
This new race of dwarves are close cousins those that reside within mountains. Once a sturdy, formidable people have now turned to the more elegant side of life. They found a wealth of gems and other minerals in their mines, and now they prefer to focus on the finer side of life.
The Bijou (bee-zho) are native Dun Bhuldar within Farrador. This makes them an amazing and seamless subrace to bring your adventure to life! They are naturally charismatic and openly welcome the presence of magic within their settlements. They are constantly looking to grow their wealth; however, they still do take care of others as they are constant donors to the less fortunate living within Lakeshire or other villages living in squalor. However, there are few that believe they should join higher societies of humans and elves in other lands.
Art by Raven Evermoor
$24,000 - New Finfolk Playable Race - (Unlocked!)
Once we have raised $24,000, we will publish the Finfolk!
The finfolk are a race of humanoid fish-like people that are natives to Starland Bay area in southern Farrador. Their communities are very welcoming and wise people that take in anyone that is in need. Originally, they were coastal settlers; however, some hungered for what the rest of the world had to offer, so they set out to explore what other settlements had to offer. Since then, they have been good neighbors and allies to those residing within Farrador. 
The finfolk are natural hunters and/or healers. Since their settlements started out in recluse from conventional society, they have had to rely on themselves for survival. They are dexterous and wise, which many account to be the pinnacle of their survival. Being naturally amphibious creatures, they excel in water type scenarios as well.
Art by Raven Evermoor
$26,000 - Farrador: A History - (Unlocked!)
Once we have raised $26,000, the Farrador: A History add-on book will be available!
This book will encompass all the known history of Farrador and how this land came to be. It will include extra information on each settlement as well as the history of how it has come to the modern point in time where you are adventuring.
It will also include the new classes, subclasses, races, subraces, magic items, and spells that you can encounter during your adventures. This way if you would like to take these new goodies to a different campaign, you can do so without carrying around your copy of Into the Unknown. 
This book will be a $10 physical add-on and a $5 PDF add-on through Backerkit post-campaign. It is estimated to be a 28 page, full color digest book.
Cover by Dmitry Yakhovsky

Pacesetter Games & Simulations has been producing old school adventures and supplements since 2008. We have produced more than 50 products in print form including several boxed sets. In general we produce content for the world's most famous fantasy RPG system (first and fifth editions as well the BX edition) but also for game systems including Swords & Wizardry, the DCC RPG, and soon Call of Cthulhu. In addition, Pacesetter produces a large line of miniature figures for all of these game systems. We attend several game conventions every year and operate one of the longest-running old school RPG tournaments in the country. Pacesetter has brought back the solo module as well as cross-platform adventures (The Red Queen series).
Bill Barsh has worked in the gaming world since 1978 and produced material for Task Force Games and Hero Games. Bill was a member of the Metro Detroit Gamers beginning in 1977 and assisted with running some the country's largest game conventions throughout the late 70s and early 80s including Origins (when it was held in Detroit). Bill also published the Deck of Many Things magazine throughout that era.
Ben Barsh started working at Pacesetter in 2015 and produced his first KS project, Rise of the Nefarious (a 5e mini-campaign) in 2018. Ben's title at Pacesetter is Operations Manager - that means he is the driving force behind how we get things done. His first major project, Rise of the Nefarious, was resounding success and ran flawlessly. He is also credited for Reaping at River's End and the Book of Beginnings, Pacesetter's most recent 5th edition products.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With any crowdfunding program, there is the risk of being late on delivery. This project is subject to various risks such as supplier failure, production company disruptions, and damages to books during the shipment process. Any and all prevention techniques will be implemented such as constant communication and updates, a strict and organized schedule, and working hard to be ahead of an unforeseeable curve to limit any issues that make come to be. In addition, to mitigate logistical delays we are using a US-based printer.

We also are aware of the negative impacts COVID-19 has brought to U.S. based businesses. We will continue to monitor the situation and work in accordance with local, state, and national safety procedures. We will work diligently to get ahead of our timeline so if the project is delayed due to COVID-19, we will have some buffer time. 

With all that said, the rough design of this project is complete. We will have the manuscript edited and thoroughly playtested. Stretch goal artwork is either completed or in production. As the Kickstarter moves along, we will be posting sample pictures of the books and their content.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Friends... it is time!
The final countdown is on! The final countdown to the unknown!
Dramatics aside, we are in the final stretch of production. From here, we work with our fabulous layout designer to make sure all points connect and the book looks "pretty" :)
We will go through this process very carefully. In a solo book, there are many, many moving parts. Especially since we decided to crop the maps to reveal only what your character would see as they move through encounter areas. This is our take on "fog of war" (examples below).

Hey, friends!
Just popping in to let you know we will be beginning layout Thursday! It may be slightly slower than normal as we want to make sure all the moving pieces (maps, room crops, room references, art, etc) find their way to the right spots. I am really certain you will like the structure of the book. We really went for ease of play over a difficult "crunch-like" setup, even though it took some more time. Thank you all for the patience. This Kickstarter community on this project rocks!
Also, a few members of Team Pacesetter will be at North Texas RPG Con in Dallas, TX this week! We will have a booth setup, so make sure to come say hello if you are attending! Our layout artist will not be at the con, so that will not delay the project :)

Hey, friends!
Per usual, I have made a YouTube video with all the information in this update if you would rather listen/watch along at home!
If you would like to avoid spoilers, do not look at the map below!
Today I just wanted to let you know where we are at. We are still 1-3 weeks out from layout. With three different editions of the book and other side books, we are making sure all the ducks are in a row. We want this to be as polished as possible before sending out.

Hey, friends!
It is finally here! Beta Test v2!
This one will take you through the first bit of adventuring you do when you run Into the Unknown. This playtest is to acquaint you with the general feel of solo adventures. If there is interest after playing this one, I would be honored to release another section of the campaign! Since this one is on the shorter side, I will likely release a v3 anyway :)

Hello, friends!
I want to start by saying happy holidays! I hope you all enjoy some time relaxing! You have certainly earned it this year!
I wanted to give an update here about Beta Test v2. We have decided to hold this for the beginning of January! While I am more than eager for you all to start adventuring within Farrador, I realize that this time of the year is logistically tough for many. To attempt to gather the most feedback possible, we thought it would be best to hold it for after the holidays. This also gives a few of the Pacesetter cast members a couple days to enjoy their families without stress of layout/editing/tuning. We hope you understand!

CRYPT OF THE SCIENCE-WIZARD, D/MCC!    
Check out that Magic-Mutant goodness!
This site-based module is designed to bring you back to the age of pulp adventure, where you can discover the secrets of the hidden tomb of an ancient wizard! Travel great distances to a remote location to unlock the mysteries sealed within an ancient tomb. What harrowing challenges are contained within? Only the bravest and quickest of wit shall survive!  
That's a lot of water...out here in the desert
Seek the entrance to the tomb of Kersete, long-lost magician of the first age and fabled hoarder of forgotten technology!
SGP has gathered together a group of industry veterans and fresh talent to create a truly challenging and fun adventure. Talented artists, old-school game designers and a veteran developer mix fan-favorite tricks and traps with modern modifications to turn these classic tropes on their heads! Don't be afraid to think outside the box, but remember; use your head or lose your head! Can you bypass the hazards of Kereste, to explore deeper into The Black Tower? 
Sometimes, you should just walk away...
Peek a boo! This is the last time you will be safe...
Maps by Ian McGarty and Skeeter Green; Interior art by Glynn Seal, Wonkee, and Ala Fedorova; cover art by Adrian Landeros.
This module mixes the style feeling of classic 1E modules with a "garage band" authenticity. This may be a module you wrote when you first started! Recapturing the excitement of playing your first rpg games is our goal and pledge!   
Enter at your own risk
This adventure borrows from the genres of swords-and-fantasy as well as post-apocalyptic science fiction; therefore, stats and game mechanics from both the Dungeon Crawl Classics AND Mutant Crawl Classics lines are presented. Please use whichever you prefer or combine them as presented into the “you got your chocolate in my peanut butter” goodness they were conceived in!
The Crypt of the Science-Wizard is a difficult adventure requiring the players to think about their environment — and requiring the characters to be skilled and lucky. While this adventure is designed for 1st level characters, some of the encounters contained within are beyond typical entry-level characters. Strategy, insight, and puzzle-solving skills serve characters (and players!) better than combat prowess. Some good dice rolls certainly help as well...   
He did NOT see that coming...
YES, this is the module that was released last year for 5E and S&W. I received so much feedback from the gaming community I decided to listen to the fans (and my inner muse), and get this out for the DCC and MCC community. Not just a rehash of statblocks, the entire module has been converted, with input from Tim “By the Gods!” Deschene and Jim Wampler. If that's not D/MCC, nothing is!
If you think a very Heavy and Metal movie adventure is what you want to play a character in, we've got just the thing!
Oh, yeah, I got some pieces of new art too...       
whoa...
That looks cool!

Dark Matter is a rip-roaring futuristic campaign setting set against a mashup of sci-fi and fantasy influences, which lets you play DnD in Space without learning a new system.
Play as bounty hunters, galactic explorers, or daring space marines in a universe inspired by the likes of Star Wars, Hitchhiker’s Guide to the Galaxy, The Expanse, and Doom. You and your crew can pilot breathtaking starships, face down alien horrors, battle evil space wizards, and explore the furthest reaches of the galaxy.
 Get the FREE demo for the Dark Matter Starter Kit and start playing today!
New pledge tiers will be unlocked as you meet stretch goals!
Dark Matter is for any player or GM who wants a little more sci-fi at their table. Though it's a full 298-page campaign setting, Dark Matter is designed with flexibility as a top priority: the rules and options in Dark Matter can seamlessly be applied to any 5E campaign from definitely-not-Star-Wars settings to all-inclusive fantasy games.
Conspiracy in the Stars! is a brand-new adventure for Dark Matter! Dive into the seedy underbelly of Port Nomad and unravel its mysteries in this 56-page neo-noir thriller. Designed for characters of 3rd to 5th level.
The starter kit contains everything you need to get started playing Dark Matter right away! It contains a full adventure, Conspiracy in the Stars!, pregenerated characters, a GM Screen, Basic Dark Matter rules, dice, battle maps, and more! With this box, you can dip your toes into the sprawling universe of Dark Matter, even if you’ve never played DnD before. Makes a great gift for newbies and RPG veterans alike!
You can get the following items by increasing your pledge by the listed amount. At the end of the campaign, you will receive a survey (via the pledge manager BackerKit) asking you to choose which add-ons you want for the extra funds you added.
(You can also choose add-ons after the campaign, but pledging for add-ons during the campaign helps to unlock more stretch goals.)
Shipping for add-ons will be calculated on the BackerKit pledge manager.  
Hematite Dice from Level Up Dice
We’ve partnered with Level Up Dice to make custom, handmade  Kickstarter-exclusive dice made from quality hematite, featuring a unique font and color, available nowhere else!
Dice Vault from Wyrmwood
We've also brought Wyrmwood on board for the perfect dice companion: an elegant, luxurious case, custom-engraved with the Dark Matter logo and made from fine wenge wood. These cases are handmade, magnetic Kickstarter-exclusives, and are positively gorgeous. 
Captain's Log from Rook and Raven
Completing the trifecta of perfect RPG companions, we have the Captain's Log from Rook and Raven. We're working with the best notebook company out there to make a custom Dark Matter campaign diary, featuring unique character sheets and pages to immortalize your sci fi campaign.   
UNLOCKED | This compact bundle comes with essential maps for any starfaring crew: ship interiors for three vessels, as well as a beautiful, asteroid-strewn starmap for space combat, on a fold-out double-sided map. Plus, it comes with 30 1-inch scale ship tokens, so you can play out elaborate space battles with minimal setup, and without an expensive fleet of miniatures. When unlocked, it will be available as a digital + physical add-on for $25.
UNLOCKED | In this new lighthearted campaign for Dark Matter, you play second-rate mercenaries working for a third-rate mercenary company, Grax’s Guys for Cheap. As part of your contract, you take whatever nonsense oddball jobs come across your desk, and your boss, none other than Grax himself, has more than enough to keep you busy. Each chapter of this campaign functions as a slapstick one-shot, as you are recruited to some new, ridiculous job for yet another unstable client.
This campaign comes from the very same writers that brought you Conspiracy in the Stars! When unlocked, it will be available in print-ready PDF as an add-on for $15.
UNLOCKED | Want even more tokens of the alien beasts and magical constructs from Dark Matter? No problem! This bundle comes with another 40 tokens of alien beasts and baddies, as well as a double-sided, four-page fold-out map that places your characters on the strange alien worlds of the Galactic Frontier.
UNLOCKED | If you’re accustomed to using high-quality spell cards for every wizard and cleric you play, these cards are a must-have. You can enjoy easy reference for spells, familiars, and ship combat roles, while your GM can keep hazard cards near at hand, in case you fly too close to a star.
UNLOCKED | In this new campaign, you play a team of mecha pilots for the Lakshay defense force. Fresh out of training, you’re given your first assignment: hunt down one of your own. A legendary Lakshay pilot has turned cloak, going AWOL with his custom prototype frame, a cutting-edge mech of unsurpassed power. It’s your job to hunt him down, and discover what infernal plot is brewing at the center of the Warzone.
The most elite Lakshay pilots, called Oni, are recognized only after one hundred confirmed kills. As you battle through the Warzone, you scratch tally marks on your frame, counting up your One Hundred kills, until you achieve the rank of Oni, or die trying.
This campaign has an all-star cast of writers on board, and will feature an entire set of rules to make your next 5e game a mecha thrill ride. When unlocked, it will be available in PDF as an add-on for $20.  
UNLOCKED | This deck of 50 high-quality tarot cards contains beautiful illustrations on one side, and full monster statistics on the other. With this deck at hand, you never need to crack open the Dark Matter book for monsters, NPCs, or mega creatures. When unlocked, will be available as an add-on for $15.
UNLOCKED | We know that not everyone can meet their regular tabletop group face-to-face at the moment, so if we meet this stretch goal, we’re going to bring Conspiracy in the Stars! (as well as all the other Dark Matter rules that come with it) to a virtual tabletop near you. When unlocked, it will be available as an add-on for $25, which includes high-resolution maps, tokens, and other VTT essentials. Mike Holik (He/Him). Mike (who isn’t on Twitter) is the editor-in-chief of Mage Hand Press. Behind the scenes, he writes, edits, and does the lion’s share of graphic design on Mage Hand Press books of all sizes, from the petite Fantastical Felines, to the colossal Dark Matter. If there’s a typo, it’s definitely his fault, but he’ll blame Justin somehow.
Justin Forkner (He/Him). Justin (@MageHandPress) is the community manager of Mage Hand Press. Most notably he introduced Wizmos to the world, but spends most of his time writing tweets, and handling all the stuff that would keep Mike from writing. If there is ever a typo in a book it's because he accidentally left Mike to his own devices for too long.
Donathin Frye (He/Him). Don (@DonathinFrye) is a full-time game designer, TTRPG writer, Gamemaster, and live-streamer. His games and adventures have been published by Modiphius Entertainment, Petersen Games, Saturday Morning Scenarios, and various other independent publishers. She is a contributing author to Beyond the Basics, a best-selling companion to the D&D Basic Rules published on DM's Guild. Charlie is currently developing and playtesting an upcoming original horror TTRPG to be released in 2021
Lili Sparx (She/They). Lili Sparx (@lilisparx) is the girl with many lives. A professional storyteller and roleplayer, Lili can be found playing TTRPG online on various channels. Makenzie De Armas (She/Her). Makenzie De Armas (@MakenzieLaneDA) is an independent tabletop game designer and content creator. She is co-designer of MCDM Productions’ Kingdoms & Warfare, frequent guest author on D&D Beyond, and lead writer for The Islands of Sina Una.
Gabe Hicks (He/Him). Gabe Hicks (@GabeJamesGames) is an independent game designer for digital and tabletop. He's currently working on a Goblin Dating Sim called Hidden Treasures but also created the CMM, an alternate creation tool for 5e focused on narrative and the class itself. Avid cosplayer, voice actor, and writer Gabe is seen wearing many hats.
Simon Goudreault (He/Him). Simon, also known as @Wandering_DM, is a freelance tabletop writer and game designer. He has published a few works on the DMG as well as DTRPG. When not streaming roleplaying games, Simon spends most of his time reading up on new games and introducing as many people as he can to the hobby.
Hero Club. Hero Club (@HeroClubPod) is an anthology TTRPG podcast that records D&D campaigns live, editing them down into immersive, fast-paced audio dramas. The creators of Hero Club have a deep love for the narrative potential of role-playing games, and have made it their mission to tell the best stories possible across as many genres as possible. After two years of playing with a rotating cast of actors, writers, and comedians, Hero Club has published 50+ hours of content, and has many more projects on the horizon. 
The Digits of Vecna. The following designers also helped bring Dark Matter to life: Jaron Mortimer spearheaded the Dark Matter worldbuilding from a home campaign into a full-on setting, Matthew Penell wrote backgrounds, monsters, and character options, Benjamin Richardson wrote magic items and monsters, and participated in playtesting, and Alexander Binns and Jason Sinclair helped with balance.

updates.update_content:
Good news: we’re finished and onto manufacturing! 
There was a small delay in a couple of details -- getting the card boxes the right size and aligning the foil patterns on the deluxe boxes (again), but everything’s lined up and we’re well on our way. Here’s what happens next:
We’re locking all BackerKit orders and charging cards in one week. Get your orders in and make sure your cards are up to date!
Timeline

The full print and play campaign, all six Grax's Club adventures, are out now for backers! You can still add it to your BackerKit if you're interested in picking it up.
The eagle-eyed among you might have noticed: six adventures? I thought Grax's Club was only four! Well, you're right! We added a 1st and 2nd level adventure, Bipinbop's Factory of Fun, which takes gratuitous inspiration from Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory. Then, we run that directly into a slightly-modified version of Conspiracy in the Stars!, the adventure included in the Starter Kit, for 3rd and 4th levels. After that comes 5th, 6th, and 7th -- The Even Most Dangerous-er Game, The Curse of the Astromo, and The Pink Star Scandal -- and finally we have a brand new adventure, 'Dex Education, a Grax's Guys field trip for 8th level characters. It's a wild campaign ride!

It’s update time! I’ve got proofs on hand!
Proofs
Almost everything went perfectly with our first set of printed proofs, which is extremely exciting. We’ll have to do one more set to iron out some weird glitches, but it’s 90% perfect.

Very quick update! 
Tl;dr: We won't be locking down BackerKit orders and charging cards until around March. Shipping will be a bit later than anticipated. 
Over the last month or so, we've been ping-ponging our files back and forth to the printers, getting them as perfect as possible, and now we're simply waiting on the physical proofs, which unfortunately won't be here until mid-February. This proof process took much longer than our last Kickstarter (thanks in part to covid and in part to working with a company in a different country), so we're running a little behind our anticipated schedule.

Sorry for the big delay between updates. We’ve been hard at work finishing up all the print files, which have now been sent off to the printers. We’ll be showing off everything we’ve done, but first, some housekeeping reminders:
We’ll be locking in all orders on BackerKit when we give the thumbs up to start printing. We’re on schedule, so that will be likely happening mid to late January. You’ll be able to update your order any time before then.
You can download all your digital rewards via dark-matter.backerkit.com

Super quick micro update: 
When we unveiled the most recent update for Dark Matter a couple of days ago, I forgot to include a link to the very important errata document, which details all of the changes we made from version 1.3 to 1.4. If you're interested, there's a link to that here. 
tl;dr Weapon range changes, new warmage subclass things, new orc race.

Surveys Are Out!
You should get an email from BackerKit containing a survey that you must fill out to get your rewards.We ask that you complete it as soon as possible so we can start preparing your orders. The longer this takes, the longer you have to wait to get your products.
I Don’t See My Survey!

updates.update_content:
The preorder store is live for anyone who missed the campaign, but the BackerKit surveys will be going out on the 22nd instead of today. On the bright side, we’ve got the Dark Matter character sheets form-fillable and ready to go!
Preorder Store
If you were late to the party, you can still get anything and everything from this Kickstarter on our BackerKit preorder store.

Our friends over at Hit Point Press, the folks who made Humblewood and the stunning animated Deck of Many spell cards, have a brand new 5e campaign setting out. Get this: it’s a horror carnival setting named Hecna!
I’ve been seeing sneak peeks of it for months and you want to back this. As always, their incredible art direction makes the rest of us look like amateurs, but this book has some terrifying twists that I genuinely don’t want to spoil. Suffice it to say, clown nose parasites are on the queue.

All the digital rewards which are finished will be going live with BackerKit on the 15th. Until then, we have time to take stock and prepare.
Tl;dr: Conspiracy in the Stars and Dark Matter are completely ready to go. Everything involving tokens or monster art is still in progress. Grax’s Club 1 is finished; all other adventures are in progress.

campaign.story:
In April 2019, Necrotic Gnome Kickstarted Old-School Essentials: Classic Fantasy — a role-playing game of magic, monsters, and adventure. Following the incredible success of that Kickstarter, Exalted Funeral and Necrotic Gnome are joining forces to massively expand the game with new character options, monsters, and magic plus a set of brand new adventure scenarios!
Old-School Essentials Expanded
Old-School Essentials: Classic Fantasy is a faithful retelling of the 1981 Basic/Expert rules, beloved for their simplicity, clarity, and flexibility. But sometimes you want MORE!
In answer to that call, we're now primed to massively expand the game, adding reams of exciting content inspired by the ever-popular Advanced 1st Edition rules. All that delicious esoteric 1970s flavour you crave is here — assassins, poisons, drow, half-orcs, mimics, xorns, vorpal swords, ioun stones... even the dreaded tarrasque! More classes, more magic, more monsters, more options. All 100% compatible with the Basic/Expert rules and presented in the familiar Old-School Essentials style.
For a preview of Old-School Essentials, check out the free Basic Rules.
Available in Two Formats: Complete Tomes and Supplements
We're producing Old-School Essentials: Advanced Fantasy in two formats:
 Complete Player's Tome and Referee's Tome: A pair of chunky tomes that form a complete game. The two tomes include everything from the Classic Fantasy game plus the new Advanced Fantasy options, making them the perfect option for people who don't have any of the previous Old-School Essentials books.
 Supplements to expand the Classic Fantasy game: The Advanced Fantasy material is also available as four supplements to the Classic Fantasy game, adding new character options, spells, monsters, and magic items. If you already have the Old-School Essentials Classic Fantasy game (the Rules Tome or the Black Box), grab the supplements to add the Advanced Fantasy options to your games.
Collector's Edition Tomes
 We're also offering a collector's edition of the Player's Tome and Referee's Tome. These will be clad in luxurious black leatherette and are graced with silver foil stamp artwork by Andrew Walter. The collector's editions are only available to Kickstarter backers!
Four Brand New Adventures
We've also got four renowned authors — Gavin Norman, Donn Stroud, Luka Rejec, and Diogo Nogueira — on board to write a brand new adventure for the game! Once the Kickstarter is over, backers will have the option of choosing any of the adventures as add-ons in the pledge manager at a special backers' price of $10! (MSRP $15.) All adventures will be produced as full-colour, A5 (Digest-sized) hardcovers.
See Stretch Goals, below, for full details on each adventure.
Pledge Levels
Here's a quick overview of the main pledge levels and which rewards they include. 
 Free Extras in Print and PDF!
As we reach higher levels of funding, all pledges (except the Dungeon Dealer retailer pledge tier) will receive free copies of a set of tasty extras! Digital backers will receive PDFs, physical backers will receive print + PDFs.
See Stretch Goals, below, for more details.
Placeholder art. Final art will differ.
Add-Ons
Once the Kickstarter has finished, backers will get access to an add-ons store where you'll be able to purchase extra rewards, including:
Adventures
Extra copies of the Advanced Fantasy books
Previous Necrotic Gnome products
T-shirts and posters
For full details about the available add-ons, scroll right down to the end!
PDFs
All books will also be provided as extensively hyperlinked PDFs — included in every pledge level. Once the Kickstarter has finished, backers will get early access to PDFs in their current, near-finished forms. Once all artwork is in place and everything is finalised, the final PDFs will be sent out to backers via DriveThruRPG.
Backer's Discount
By backing this Kickstarter, you're not only helping us bring all this fantastic new material to life, but will also be getting hold of the new books at a discount off the eventual retail price! The retail prices of all the new books will be as follows:
 Advanced Fantasy: Genre Rules: $17
 Advanced Fantasy: Druid and Illusionist Spells: $17
 Advanced Fantasy: Monsters: $17
 Advanced Fantasy: Treasures: $17
 Advanced Fantasy: Player's Tome: $40
 Advanced Fantasy: Referee's Tome: $40
 13 Fantastic Character Classes 
Play as a nimble acrobat, a devious assassin, a brash barbarian, a charming bard, a devout cleric, a mysterious druid, a doughty fighter, an enigmatic illusionist, a noble knight, a sagacious magic-user, an ardent paladin, a stealthy ranger, or a cunning thief.
10 Classic Character Races 
Choose to be a sinister drow, an avaricious duergar, a bold dwarf, a graceful elf, an artful gnome, a spirited half-elf, a plucky halfling, an outcast half-orc, a passionate human, or a stony svirfneblin.
All demihuman character races are presented with rules for playing as a traditional race-class or by choosing your character's race and class separately.
Over 200 Mighty Spells
A library of 34 cleric spells, 34 druid spells, 72 illusionist spells, and 72 magic-user spells. These spell are also used by bards, drow, elves, gnomes, half-elves, paladins, and rangers.
Over 300 Fearsome Monsters
A timeless collection of over 300 fearsome beasts! Includes full encounter tables by dungeon level and wilderness terrain type.
Over 300 Wondrous Magic Items
A hoard of classic magic items, encompassing enchanted weapons and armour; magic wands, staves and rods; magical scrolls, rings, and potions; and the plethora of weird and wondrous items that don't fit into any of those categories! Includes full rules for sentient swords.
Deluxe Quality
Just like previous Old-School Essentials products, the new Old-School Essentials: Advanced Fantasy books will be produced at a deluxe level of quality — hardcover books with sewn bindings. These will be beautiful and seriously durable books! We also have a series of stretch goals lined up to further upgrade the physical quality with fancy extras.
Usability
Old-School Essentials is meticulously edited and laid out, with the focus on maximising ease of reference during play. No more searching for references scattered across multiple pages. No more scanning dense paragraphs of text to pick out details. Everything in Old-School Essentials is logically organised and collated, and presented in a quick-to-read format based on "control panels" — two-page spreads presenting a single topic in its entirety. (See page examples below or check out the free Basic Rules.)
Compatibility
Old-School Essentials is 100% compatible with the original Basic/Expert rules (B/X) — the most popular old-school rule set. All material written for the B/X rules over the last 39 years can be used with Old-School Essentials, without any conversion effort whatsoever! What's more, the additional material inspired by the Advanced 1st Edition increases the wealth of compatible material even further!
Digital Extras
Old-School Essentials is supported by a selection of character sheets, an online rules reference for the Classic Fantasy game, and a set of wonderful online generators for rolling up encounters, treasure hoards, NPCs, and more at the click of a button! What's more, devoted fan communities have developed Old-School Essentials support in a number of Virtual Table-Tops, for example: Roll20, Astral VTT, Foundry VTT.
Community
As the second fastest growing game on Roll20 in Q1 2020, an incredible community has formed around Old-School Essentials. Come and join our groups on the following social media platforms:
Old-School Essentials Facebook group.
Necrotic Gnome Discord server.
Necrotic Gnome MeWe group.
Character creation section
Complete dungeon exploration rules on 2 side-by-side pages
Complete rules for spell books on 2 side-by-side pages
Monsters section
Here's what all the books will look like.
The Player's Tome. Cover art by Peter Mullen. Details in gold foil. 248 pages, A5 (Digest-sized). Contains the complete game rules, a massive selection of character classes and races, hundreds of spells, and full lists of equipment, mounts, vehicles, and hirelings.
The Referee's Tome. Cover art by Peter Mullen. Details in gold foil. 248 pages, A5 (Digest-sized). Contains a massive bestiary of over 300 monsters, extensive encounter tables, a hoard of over 300 magic items, along with advice on refereeing and guidelines for creating adventures.
Advanced Fantasy: Player's Tome collector's edition. Black leatherette with silver foil stamp art by Andrew Walter. Only available to Kickstarter backers!
Advanced Fantasy: Referee's Tome collector's edition. Black leatherette with silver foil stamp art by Andrew Walter. Only available to Kickstarter backers!
Advanced Fantasy: Genre Rules. Cover art by Stefan Poag. 56 pages, A5 (Digest-sized). Expands the Classic Fantasy game with 15 new character classes, poisons, plus optional rules for choosing character race and class separately.
Advanced Fantasy: Druid and Illusionist Spells. Cover art by Stefan Poag. 48 pages, A5 (Digest-sized). Expands the Classic Fantasy game with over 100 spells usable by bards, druids, gnomes, illusionists, and rangers.
Advanced Fantasy: Monsters. Cover art by Stefan Poag. 56 pages, A5 (Digest-sized). Expands the Classic Fantasy game with 120 new monsters.
Advanced Fantasy: Treasures. Cover art by Stefan Poag. 56 pages, A5 (Digest-sized). Expands the Classic Fantasy game with 150 new magic items.
The base funding goal of this Kickstarter is sufficient to do a print run of the new Old-School Essentials: Advanced Fantasy books. If funding should reach higher levels, we have a lot of tasty upgrades and extras lined up.
Tome Upgrade: Printed End-Papers [Unlocked — $25,000]
The Player's and Referee's Tomes will be upgraded with fancy printed end-papers, featuring the most commonly used tables. All backers at a pledge tier that includes the Player's Tome or the Referee's Tome will get this upgrade at no extra cost.
Supplements Upgrade: Printed End-Papers [Unlocked — $30,000]
The Advanced Fantasy supplements will be upgraded with fancy printed end-papers, featuring the most commonly used tables. All backers at a pledge tier that includes the supplements will get this upgrade at no extra cost.
Tome Upgrade: Ribbon Marker [Unlocked — $40,000]
The Player's and Referee's Tomes will be upgraded with a fancy ribbon marker, for quick access to your favourite sections. All backers at a pledge tier that includes the Player's Tome or the Referee's Tome will get this upgrade at no extra cost.
Tome Upgrade: 2nd Ribbon Marker [Unlocked — $50,000]
The Player's and Referee's Tomes will be upgraded with a second fancy ribbon marker! All backers at a pledge tier that includes the Player's Tome or the Referee's Tome will get this upgrade at no extra cost.
 The Incandescent Grottoes, by Gavin Norman [Unlocked —  $60,000]
Backers will have the option of selecting this adventure as an add-on in the pledge manager at a special, reduced price of $10 (MSRP $15).
About the adventure: A classic expedition into the Mythic Underworld: a bubbling stream cascades into a hole in the earth, leading to a series of pools, underground watercourses, and scintillating grottoes. Adventurers who delve within may discover a profusion of odd mosses and fungi, an ancient tomb complex, the lairs of weird, subterranean monsters, and the hide-out of an exiled illusionist. The Incandescent Grottoes is a companion adventure to Gavin's previous scenario, The Hole in the Oak. The two adventures can be played independently of each other or can be connected to form a larger dungeon.
About Gavin: Gavin is the creator of Old-School Essentials, creator of the Dolmenwood campaign setting, and author of critically acclaimed, weird fairy tale-esque adventures (Winter's Daughter, The Hole in the Oak).
 Holy Mountain Shaker, by Luka Rejec [Unlocked — $70,000]
Backers will have the option of selecting this adventure as an add-on in the pledge manager at a special, reduced price of $10 (MSRP $15).
About the adventure: The earth shakes. Trees sway like grass before the hungry wind. Again. Chimneys fall like childrens' toys in the streets of Doll Town. Again. The capstone of the tomb of the first folk tumbles and breaks. The divine carp beneath the sacred mountain is angry. The town needs heroes. Brave souls to enter the deep places, the abandoned temples, the lightless waters at the roots of the mountains. Holy fools to appease the wonder fish. Is service to the community not draw enough? The townsfolk wag eyebrows and mutter and complain. Then admit. There are old treasures there, too. Glittery scales of gold and adamant, yes. But also doors to the other worlds, where demons of disease may be banished, whence lost friends may be retrieved from death's dusty grasp.
About Luka: Luka is an artist and writer, probably best known for the ENnie-winning Ultraviolet Grasslands, though he would prefer to be better known for the apocryphal adventures of Pointyhelmet and Poncho.
 Isle of the Plangent Mage, by Donn Stroud [Unlocked — $80,000]
Backers will have the option of selecting this adventure as an add-on in the pledge manager at a special, reduced price of $10 (MSRP $15).
About the adventure: Isle of the Plangent Mage takes players to multiple locations above and below the ocean. Areas worth exploring include a hidden cove, an old rickety lighthouse, a small fishing village, a weird island, and a mysterious lair that plunges the to depths of the underwater world. Ultrasonic magics, strange aural puzzles, monstrosities from the deep, suspicious villagers, and beached whales all stand between discovering the truth behind the dealings and the demise of the Plangent Mage.
About Donn: Donn began his public gaming persona when he concocted and launched (with co-host Adam Muszkiewicz) Drink Spin Run: The RPG Talkshow Podcast. After talking to RPG writers, designers, and other creatives, he decided to move from podcasting to writing and publishing his own material. 
Free PDF: Spell Trackers [Unlocked — $110,000]
We’ll produce a PDF with four spell trackers — one for each type of spells (cleric, druid, illusionist, magic-user) — allowing players to easily keep track of the spells their character has memorized. The trackers will also serve as a quick reference for the range and duration of spells. This PDF will be made available as a free download.
Free PDF: Dungeon Time Tracker [Unlocked — $115,000]
We’ll produce a PDF with a dungeon time tracker as an aid for referees in keeping track of dungeon turns. This PDF will be made available as a free download.
Generators Website Upgrade: Advanced Random Encounter Rollers [Unlocked — $120,000]
We’ll enhance the Old-School Essentials generators website with the ability to roll random encounters including the full spread of Classic Fantasy + Advanced Fantasy monsters! The enhanced generators will be available for the whole world to use.
Generators Website Upgrade: Advanced Treasure and Magic Item Rollers [Unlocked — $125,000]
We’ll enhance the Old-School Essentials generators website with the ability to roll random treasure hoards including the full spread of Classic Fantasy + Advanced Fantasy magic items! The enhanced generators will be available for the whole world to use.
Generators Website Upgrade: Advanced Memorized Spells Rollers [Unlocked — $130,000]
We’ll enhance the Old-School Essentials generators website with the ability to roll random memorized spell lists for all spell casting classes introduced in the Advanced Fantasy books! The enhanced generators will be available for the whole world to use.
Generators Website Upgrade: Advanced NPC Rollers [Unlocked — $135,000]
We’ll enhance the Old-School Essentials generators website with the ability to roll random NPCs including the full spread of Classic Fantasy + Advanced Fantasy character classes! The enhanced generators will be available for the whole world to use.
Character Options Booklet [Unlocked — $150,000]
We'll produce a Kickstarter exclusive zine-style booklet containing 4 brand new Old-School Essentials classes (the beast master, the changeling, the mycelian, and the warden) designed by Gavin Norman! Further stretch goals will unlock additional content in the booklet.
All non-retail backers will receive a free copy of the booklet! (Digital backers will receive the booklet in PDF form.) (The content featured in the booklet may also appear in future Old-School Essentials products.)
Reference Booklet [Unlocked — $160,000]
We'll produce a zine-style booklet containing the most commonly used tables and rules for Old-School Essentials Advanced Fantasy games.
All non-retail backers will receive a free copy of the booklet! (Digital backers will receive the booklet in PDF form.)
Free Adventure: The Incandescent Grottoes! [Unlocked — $170,000]
All non-retail backers will receive a free copy of the first of the three new adventures we'll be producing — The Incandescent Grottoes, by Gavin Norman. See above for more information on the adventure.
(Digital backers will receive the adventure in PDF form.)
Character Options Booklet Expansion 1 [Unlocked — $180,000]
We'll expand the character options booklet with two more brand new classes designed by Gavin Norman: the mage and the chaos knight!
Character Options Booklet Expansion 2 [Unlocked — $190,000]
We'll expand the character options booklet with two more brand new classes designed by Gavin Norman: the mutoid and the bard (2e take)!
All Adventures Upgraded to Hardcover! [Unlocked — $200,000]
The new adventure scenarios (see other stretch goals) will be printed in hardcover format at no extra cost! All non-retail backers will receive a free copy of the first of the three new adventures we'll be producing — The Incandescent Grottoes, by Gavin Norman. Once the Kickstarter is over, backers will have the option of selecting the other adventures as add-ons in the pledge manager at a special, reduced price of $10 (MSRP $15).
 Tomes Upgrade: Foiling [Unlocked — $225,000]
We'll take the Advanced Fantasy Player's Tome and Referee's Tome into the upper echelons of RPG rule book society with the addition of gold foiling to the covers! All the graphical elements which are currently white (e.g. the book title, the Old-School Essentials logo, etc) will be transformed into gold foil.
 Second Free Adventure: The Halls of the Blood King! [Unlocked — $250,000]
All non-retail backers will receive a free copy of a new adventure — The Halls of the Blood King, by Diogo Nogueira. See above for more information on the adventure.
(Digital backers will receive the adventure in PDF form.)
 Free Necrotic Gnome Dice! [Locked — $300,000]
We'll produce d6 dice featuring the Necrotic Gnome logo. All physical backers (except the retailer Dungeon Dealer pledge level) will receive 3d6 free of charge!
More...?
If we smash through the $300,000 stretch goal, we may just have more plans for name level and beyond... 
Current Production Status
Writing and layout of the rule books are complete and illustration is under way. Work on the adventure scenarios will proceed once each of them is unlocked.
Timeline
 September 2020: Kickstarter finishes.
 September to November 2020: Writers, artists, editors, and layout gnomes at work.
 November 2020: Manufacturing begins.
 December 2020: Manufacturing finishes, products start shipping to warehouses.
 February to March 2021: Kickstarter rewards start shipping out to backers.
The Team
Wondering who's behind all of this? Allow us to elucidate:
 Exalted Funeral: Taking the old-school RPG world (and several other worlds!) by storm over the last few years, Exalted Funeral is a rapidly growing publisher of high quality, creative gaming content.
 Gavin Norman: Author of Old-School Essentials and founder of Necrotic Gnome. Gavin has driven the Old-School Essentials project since its inception, and is the mastermind behind the writing, layout, and art direction. Gavin's adventure Winter's Daughter was nominated for two ENnie awards in 2019.
 Donn Stroud: Co-host of the infamous Drink, Spin, Run podcast. Donn's adventure Dead Planet won an ENnie in 2019 and his adventure A Pound of Flesh won another ENnie in 2020.
 Luka Rejec: Luka's magnum opus psychedelic metal campaign setting, The Ultraviolet Grasslands, won two ENnie awards in 2020.
 Diogo Nogueira: Renowned creator of the platinum selling old-school RPGs Sharp Swords & Sinister Spells and Solar Blades & Cosmic Spells (along with many, many other games!).
 Frederick Münch: The coding maestro behind the Old-School Essentials SRD and generator website!
 Peter Mullen: Revered for his fantastically imaginative work on the Dungeon Crawl Classics RPG and many other old-school games, Peter's paintings grace the front of the Advanced Fantasy Player's Tome and Referee's Tome! 
 Andrew Walter: Beloved creator of the wondrous covers of the Old-School Essentials Classic Fantasy game, two new pieces by Andrew are featured on the collector's edition Player's Tome and Referee's Tome.
 Stefan Poag: Esteemed creator of weird and wonderful fantasy art, including many pieces for the Mutant Crawl Classics RPG, Metamorphosis Alpha, and many others. Stefan created the cover art for the Advanced Fantasy supplements.
 Interior artists: The interiors of the books are lavishly illustrated by over 30 artists, including many old-school favourites: Mustafa Bekir, Jerry Boucher, Michael Clarke, Thomas Denmark, Per Gradin, Pauliina Hannuniemi, Mike Hill, Jon Hodgson, Tom Kilian, Mark Kosobucki, Kyle Latino, Emma Lazauski, Jethro Lentle, Mark Lyons, Chris Malec, Sam Mameli, Alex Mayo, Bradley McDevitt, Penny Melgarejo, Peter Mullen, Diogo Nogueira, Thomas Novosel, Juan Ochoa, Stefan Poag, Olivia Politz, Sean Poppe, Spaghetti Quester, Rachel Quinlan, Matthew Ray, Luka Rejec, Peter Saga, Audre Schutte, Johannes Stahl, Del Teigeler, Andrew Walter, Julee Wolke.
US - UK - EU Friendly Shipping!
All rewards inside Europe will be shipped from Germany (to EU backers) or the UK (to UK backers). All rewards outside of Europe will be shipped from the USA. All packages will be sent tracked, worldwide.
Estimated shipping rates: Shipping is not included in the pledge tiers. It will be charged in the pledge manager later on, and will be calculated depending on your location and the weight of your rewards (including any add-ons you select). See below for shipping cost estimates for each pledge level based on current shipping rates.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Exalted Funeral and Necrotic Gnome are both experienced in running and fulfilling highly successful Kickstarters. We're renowned for our communicative and open development process, so you can be sure of receiving a steady stream of updates as the project progresses.

The risks involved in this project are low. The text of the Advanced Fantasy books is 100% finished. The layout is done. The cover art is done. About 50% of the interior illustrations are in place. All that remains, development-wise, is for the artists to get working on the final illustrations, to be slotted into the layout.

We've previously worked (on very large projects!) with the printer who'll be manufacturing the books, so their professionalism and commitment to high quality are known factors. They do excellent work, fast and don't bat an eyelid when we tell them we need to print 30,000 books.

As for the stretch goals, we've been careful to not get carried away adding loads of extra content which could risk decimating the project timelines. The physical upgrades to the books don't entail any additional development time (they just cost extra!). The adventure scenarios obviously require additional print production but this work has already been factored into the planned shipping dates, so the risk is minimal. The authors, illustrators, editors, and layout folks involved are all professionals whom we've worked with before and can rely on.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello!

Several of you have reached out about receiving Backerkit notifications for past shipments so let me clarify. 

When the add-on shirts, posters, and canvas prints were shipped out in March, there was no way to connect the printing service to Backerkit for shipping and fulfillment. In order for those items to show as fulfilled the tracking numbers had to be manually uploaded into Backerkit.  This was done once all of the items had been shipped and most of them already received by backers. Those notifications had not been pushed through at that time from Backerkit to the backers because all of the shipments had already been recieved.
The Time Has Come!

campaign.story:
Meet the NEW ADV3NTURE Hoodie! It has all of the personality of our original ADV3NTURE Hoodie, which is the most funded hoodie ever on Kickstarter. But this one is better made, has a 5-year guarantee, and this guy's made right here in America! 
We're back with TWO NEW HOODIES that are All-American. At ADV3NTURE, we launch our new products on Kickstarter because we love the community that we have built through crowdfunding. With the success our brand has experienced, we're back with hoodies that are more stylish, more comfortable, and have improvements to people's favorite innovations.
THE ADV3NTURE HOODIE and THE CLASSIC HOODIE are hand-crafted in America, from the ground up. It all starts with American cotton grown in North Carolina, zippers made in Georgia, and the final product being cut and sewn in California. Our new hoodies (and as of 2020, ALL of our  products) are made by hard-working Americans, like you.
Our ADV3NTURE Hoodie brings back everyone's favorite features and innovations in a more refined and durable version of our original hoodie. It's designed to be your favorite everyday hoodie with comfort, stylishness and quality at the forefront. It has innovative construction elements, like a three-panel hood, over-locking seams, and our proprietary French terry loop fabric.
Our CLASSIC Hoodie has the same silhouette as the new ADV3NTURE Hoodie, including the comfort, durability, and construction. We removed some of the innovations of from the ADV3NTURE hoodie. What we ended up with was a stylish, premium hoodie with just the right number of features and enough colors for every day of the week!
 The ADV3NTURE Hoodie and the CLASSIC Hoodie have the same dimensions and measurements and are made with the same fabric and materials. Below is a comparison of their features.
We are offering the ADV3NTURE and CLASSIC hoodies in EIGHT colors. There are no stretch goals, where we need to raise a certain amount in this campaign before they become available. ALL colors, named after California landmarks, are available once the campaign reaches its funding goal. At the end of the campaign, you will be emailed a survey (to the email associated with your Kickstarter account) where you'll tell us the color(s) and size(s) that you'd like us to send you.
If you'd like to add additional hoodies to your pledge once the campaign is over, you can do so easily in your survey. 
Our Catalina hoodie was inspired by the blue waters around Santa Catalina, an island off the coast of Los Angeles. One of California’s Channel Islands, it's known for its wildlife, dive sites and Mt. Orizaba, its highest peak.
Our Humboldt green hood was inspired by the green hills of Humboldt county, 270 miles north of San Francisco. Humboldt County is a densely forested region with nearly 1,500,000 acres of forest land and contains dozens of national, state, and local parks. They are also know for a particular green crop, but that had nothing to do with the name... we promise.
Our Mojave color was inspired by the sands of Mojave National Preserve, the third largest of the America's National Parks. Singing sand dunes, cinder cone volcanoes, and a large Joshua tree forest are found within this 1.6-million-acre park. A visit to its canyons, mountains, and mesas will reveal long-abandoned mines, homesteads,  rock-walled military outposts, and an abandoned train depot.
This color was inspired by the wines of the Napa Valley, widely considered one of the top wine regions in the US. Visiting one of the valley's wineries every day would take over a year! More than four hundred wineries and grows many different grape varieties including Cabernet Sauvignon, Chardonnay, Merlot, Zinfandel, and other popular varietals.
Rising nearly 5,000 feet above Yosemite Valley and 8,800 feet above sea level, Half Dome is a Yosemite icon. This hoodie is a tribute to this impressive natural monument. Considered to be unclimbable in 1865, Half Dome was first summitted in 1875. The south face of Half Dome is now "conquered" by thousand of people every year.
This color was inspired by California's Lassen Volcanic National Park, home to steaming fumaroles, meadows freckled with wildflowers, clear mountain lakes, and numerous volcanoes. Jagged peaks tell the story of its eruptive past while hot water continues to shape the land. Lassen Volcanic offers opportunities to discover the wonder and mysteries of volcanoes and hot water for visitors willing to explore the undiscovered.
This hoodie is a tribute to the US Navy, which has a strong presence in California, and all branches of the military. Cheers to all of the brave men and women who risk their lives to protect our way of life! For all serving, and who have served, we greatly appreciate your service and sacrifice.
This hoodie is a tribute to Black Rock, a lava rock outcropping at the north end of Ka'anapali Beach. The Hawai’ian name for Black Rock is Pu’u Keka’a, and ancient Hawaiians believed that this was the place where their spirits went to jump off to join ancestors forever. This color is also a nod to our friends at Maui Brewing Company, who have been supporters of Adv3nure since the beginning. We can't wait to have a beer with you soon! 
We have always taken pride creating thoughtful innovations into our garments. Over the years, we have been refining and perfecting the features of our hoodies to make them streamlined and subtle. You'll find some of your favorite features in the descriptions below, as well as some of our developments in manufacturing, which make these hoodies better than any we have made.
Our signature Beverage Pocket holds your drink, so you can keep your hands free to do other things. Hold your coffee while you walk to the dog and talk on the phone. Hold your beer while you hold your plate and a fork. Hold a baby bottle while you hold your baby. We're SURE you'll find plenty of uses for this pocket! 
Our Thumb-Hole Mitts have been a favorite feature of the ADV3NTURE Hoodie since the beginning! Unfold the cuffs to reveal the thumb-holes and enough material to keep your hands warm. Whether you use them as drinking gloves (to keep your beverage from warming up in your hands) or to keep your hands warm as the temperature drops, try them once and you'll be hooked!  
Both of our hoodies convert into pillows, a feature we find constantly useful. Simply roll them up into the Three-Panel Hood, which has been designed for the pillow conversion. Whether you're a passenger on a long car ride or want a place to rest your head while camping, the pillow conversion will be more convenient than you can imagine.
The Three-Panel Hood has been design to more comfortably fit your head. Rather than a one-piece hood where the fabric is bunched to create the shape of your melon, our three-panel hood uses three components to create an incredibly comfortable head covering.
The Passport Pocket lets you keep your valuable, like money, your ID, phone, or your passport close to your chest. The ZigZag stitching around the pocket holds the interior pocket in place, so the contents of your pocket stay secure.
The split Kangaroo Pockets are held in place by over-lock stitching and bar-tack reinforced edges to ensure their durability. The openings of the pockets are angled for maximum comfort as they hold your hands and keep them warm. 
Inside the right kangaroo pocket is a hidden pocket inside to secure your valuable, like your keys, so they don't fall out while you're adventuring. It will give you extra confidence when carrying items around in your pockets. 
Most independent craft breweries (which we're fans of) are canning beer rather than bottling it, but as a throwback to the bottle-openers that we used to include in our hoodies and jackets, we're including this canvas bottle-opener PATCH (similar to the ones in our flannels), so you can twist off your bottle caps without damaging the French terry loop fabric. 
 All of the zippers on the new hoodies are metal YKK zippers, the most durable, high-quality zippers available. And, they're made right here in the USA. This includes the main zipper on the ADV3NTURE and CLASSIC hoodies, as well as the zippers on the beverage pocket and passport pocket. 
 We've added Elbow Pads to the arms of the ADV3NTURE Hoodie for added comfort, as well as to reduce wear on the area where your hoodie will come into contact with hard surfaces. They also add a bit of style to your hoodie, so people know you mean business. 
 It's not quite as complicated as a GPS tracker, but our return home tag, and the honesty of a good samaritan should get your hoodie back to you if you happen to leave it on one of your adventures. It also contains our pledge to plant three trees with every purchase, including the hoodie you receive from this campaign.
Here's a closer look!
 We've made sure that all of the stitching used in our hoodies keep your hoodie intact during your adventures. We use over-lock stitching on the top of the shoulders, so they lay flat, to make the seams comfortable if you happen to be wearing a backpack. 
We’ve spent nine months developing a unique fabric that we love. It’s a high-density French terry fabric blend that is the best overall weight, and retains the its shape (being nearly shrink resistant), maintains durability, and is the optimal softness. 
Our hoodies start with raw cotton grown in North Carolina, where it is combed and spun in a yarn mill. The yarn is then transported to Los Angeles, where the yarns are knitted into our proprietary French terry loop. The fabric is then sent to our dye house, where the fabric blend achieves its subtle heathered appearance. It is then pre-washed (pre-shrunk) in our manufacturing facility. At that point, the fabric is inspected for any imperfections from the knitting or dying process. Once the fabric passes inspection, it is then ready to be cut and sewn into your new hoodie.
Keeping our manufacturing domestic enables us ensure the highest quality of raw materials that are sourced for production, while allowing us to oversee the entire process to ensure high production standards through the entire process. We are also able to ensure that our high environmental standards are being maintained.
Hand-crafting our products domestically lets us keep jobs in the US, especially in a time where they’re needed most. We are incredibly proud that all of our apparel is made by hard-working Americans.     
Being an environmentally conscious brand means we understand the importance of the environment and our affect on it. We are actively taking steps to reduce our carbon footprint by utilizing domestic raw materials and planting three trees to offset our environmental impact.
The "3" in our name represents the three trees that we plant with every purchase, including this Kickstarter campaign.
To find the size that best suits you, take your favorite hoodie and lay it on a flat surface. Compare the measurements of your hoodie with the measurements below. If washed properly (was cold and lay flat to dry) your hoodie should not shrink more than 1-2%. The polyester woven into the fabric maintains shape retention.
In addition to the standard sizes XS-2XL, we are offering BIG & TALL sizes. This includes TALL sizes in Large and X-Large, as well as 3X-5XL. These sizes require new patterns to be created, as well as extra fabric in the manufacturing, and extra shipping charges, due to the additional weight. If you order a BIG & TALL size, you will have to pay an additional charge when you receive your survey. Those ordering TALL sizes will be required to pay an additional $10. Those ordering 3X-5XL will be required to pay an additional $15.
The additional shipping charges added to your pledge for international orders does not include duties, taxes, customs VAT, or any other fees that may be charged by your country. Unfortunately, there are too many variables for us to properly calculate any additional charges. We are sorry for any inconvenience.
This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarter launches with 1,400+ successful Kickstarter projects and over $500M raised in total.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This isn’t our first rodeo. Infact, it’s our fourth. We launch our new, innovative products on Kickstarter because we love the community that we’ve become a part of. We have an amazing customer service and fulfillment team. Shoot us an email (info@adv3nture.com) and we’d love to answer your questions! We pride ourselves on open communication and thrive with input from our community. Please don’t ever hesitate to reach out if you feel there is something we could be doing better! 

Please note that it is VERY important that you fill out your survey as soon as you receive it. 1-2 days after the campaign is concluded, you will be emailed a link to a Kickstarter survey. If you don’t, check your junk email folder or email us as we’ll get it sorted out. In your survey, you’ll provide us with your color choices(s), size(s) and address, so we know WHAT to send you and WHERE to send it. At the conclusion of the campaign, once the surveys are collected, we will be placing the order with our manufacturer. At that point, it takes about 60 days for the hoodies to be manufactured and mailed to you.

We have done this before and learned from the many challenges that we have encountered. We are confident that we will deliver these hoodies on time. Please be aware that if we are sending your hoodie(s) internationally, we will not be able to prepay the duties for international shipments, so you will be responsible for covering those charges. There are so many variables with international shipping that we are not able to accurately determine the duties and tax rates and pre-pay for every country, city, provinces, etc.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
