updates.update_content:
It's been a month since our last update and unfortunately it has taken this long to get an update. We're doing our best with info and apologize for the delays of new information.
We are receiving a large (partial) shipment of Adv3nture Lassen Hoodies. While this won't cover all Lassen rewards, it is a larger shipment than our two previous. This delivery will not include Tall Sizes. We still have no word on tall sizing for any colors, though we are suspecting these will be the last hoodies made. We do expect to receive and begin fulfilling these Lassen hoodies next week. Given the size of the delivery, it will take 1-2 weeks to fulfill. You will receive a confirmation email once we have processed your reward.

We are receiving our second (partial) shipment of Adv3nture Lassen Hoodies, as well as a handful of Adv3nture Navy. Like last time, this is a small delivery and does not include all sizes or quantities. Lassen was our most popular color, so this will only make a small dent into our total order. We expect to start shipping these out next week, but due to the smaller quantities being received, not everyone will be receiving their Lassen this round. 
We do not have any updates on Tall Sizes (any color), or the large outstanding quantities of mixed sizes and colors (Mojave, Catalina, Humboldt, Navy, Napa, Half Dome, Black Rock). 
Due to several factors out of our control, the manufacturing process for the Adv3nture Hoodies continues to be slow. While there are still some challenges due to COVID, which has our manufacturer working at a limited capacity, our relationship with the manufacturer continues to get worse, as we push for better communication. This Kickstarter has been a very difficult process for everyone involved, and we can't thank you enough for your patience as we work hard to provide you with more information.

We are finally receiving our first (partial) shipment of Adv3nture Lassen Hoodies. This is a small delivery and does not include all sizes or quantities. Lassen was our most popular color, so this shipment will be the first of many. We'll be getting these into our fulfillment center this week and begin shipping these out. It's important to note that because of the limited quantities being received, not everyone will be receiving their Lassen this round of deliveries.
We do not have any updates on Tall Sizes (any color), or the large outstanding quantities of mixed sizes and colors (Mojave, Catalina, Humboldt, Navy, Napa, Half Dome, Black Rock). Our frustration with our manufacturer is palatable, and we are still working to get more information on these.

It's been almost a month since our last update, and we've shipped out many of the hoodies that were rewards from our Kickstarter campaign. We are just as frustrated as those people still waiting for their hoodies in anticipation of quickly bringing this to a close. COVID has thrown us more curve balls than anyone could have anticipated, and we are doing everything we can to be expeditious in getting everyone's rewards shipped out.
We are still waiting for the Adv3nture Lassen, the Tall sizes (of all colors), and a mix of other sizes/styles. The majority of hoodies have (thankfully) have made their way to backers, but we know we still have more to get out, and every customer is as important as the next.

Most of you are aware of the ongoing production issues surrounding COVID and our manufacturing partners in Los Angeles. We are frustrated with the slow progress and the disappointment it has brought to all our customers.
We're excited to share that we've started receiving the Adv3nture Humboldt and Adv3nture Napa hoodies. Not all sizes are included in these shipments, but it is a large portion. It will take a little time to get these in and out the door, but we're working on it.

Good morning/afternoon/evening (depending on where you are)!
We're happy to report that the Classic Navy, Classic Napa, and Adv3nture Black Rock have just arrived at our fulfillment center in Seattle, WA. We've begun processing these and should be able to ship all orders that included any of these items within 24 hours. 
We still have no word on Adv3nture Lassen, Adv3nture Napa, or Adv3nture Humboldt. Nor do we have any word on Tall sizes for any of our hoodies. We're working daily with our partners to finish this up, as well as get more/better communication from our manufacturer.

Wishing everyone a happy and safe 2021!
We're working daily with our manufacturer to keep information coming. We recently received a shipment of Classic Lassen, Classic Black Rock, Classic Humbolt, Classic Mojave, and Classic Catalina. We'll be shipping these out immediately to fulfill all complete orders. 
We did not receive the Adv3nture versions of these and still don't have word on when we will, but we are working to get a better timeline from the factory.

What. A. Year.
We are working hard to provide updates as often as we get them, but we've only been sending them out when we have firm information to update you with. The bottom line is that things have been incredibly slow on both the manufacturing and shipping end, which (as much as we push them) is out of our control. We can say that we have been extremely happy with the quality and craftsmanship of the hoodies that we have received and shipping out.

We're excited to report that although we've had some 2020-related challenges (as most businesses have),  the Adv3nture Hoodies have begun rolling off the line. There have been some unexpected supply issues, because clothing manufacturing is not seen as an "essential" business. That makes sense. However our customers are essential to our business. So, we have physically been at the factory every day, helping to work through those challenges.

campaign.story:
Issue #1 features cover art by UK artist Barrie James.
The Fanzine You Didn’t Know You Needed
With metric tons of mighty new content for your post-apocalyptic or genre-mash fantasy game, SCIENTIFIC BARBARIAN #1 has it all. You’ll be amazed at The Ecology of the Crater Mutant by Levi Combs (Planet X Games), astounded at the robotic mounts of S.A.B.L.E. Rangers by Mike and Elizabeth Stewart (Victorious RPG), and astonished at the malevolent diseases in Mutant Maladies by Skeeter Green (SGP Games). All that and a mini-adventure that’s not-so-mini in Jim Wampler’s The Gene Looms of Janeck-Vacca. 
Behold just a few of the tantalizing delights in SCIENTIFIC BARBARIAN #1!
All That, Plus Regular Features
SCIENTIFIC BARBARIAN #1 also includes ongoing features that will continue in every issue, with new mutations, new monsters, new artifacts, Retro Reviews of inspirational source media and material, and of course Scientific Comics right in the back!
Not Just For the Radioactive at Heart
Sure, all this great new gaming material has been designed with the discriminating post-apocalyptic gamer in mind, but it is also eminently suitable for fantasy games — especially if your campaign needs a fresh jolt of excitement. In both the pulp literature that inspired our hobby and in the fantasy games of yore, many a magic item or monster turned out to have scientific origins. The contents of SCIENTIFIC BARBARIAN are ideal for getting seen-it-all done-it-all fantasy players back on their toes and engaged with new surprises. All material presented is useable with any d20-based game system.
Manifest of Wonders
SCIENTIFIC BARBARIAN #1 will be a 6” x 9” digest-size square-bound book so it will look great on your shelf or slip easily into your game bag. Survey the table of contents for issue #1!
How to Pledge for Multiple Copies
Need to pledge for multiple copies of SCIENTIFIC BARBARIAN #1? Just select the pledge level for the PRINT + PDF and fill out the dollar amount in multiples of $15 (i.e., $30 for two copies, $45 for three copies, etc).
Retailer Pledge Level
Especially in these trying times, we support all our brick-and-mortar game stores. If you are a retailer and wish to pledge at the Retailer Pledge Level, all we ask is that you send us verification via email or messages after pledging.
Shipping Costs
Each book will be shipped to backers USPS First Class in a sturdy cardboard envelope. Per Kickstarter recommendations, shipping and handling costs ARE NOT INCLUDED IN THE PLEDGE LEVELS. Shipping and handling is an economical $5 per book shipped. Retailer shipping will be via Media Mail and is also only $5.
All shipping for this Kickstarter is to the USA ONLY, so please pledge accordingly. Current International shipping costs are so high that shipping outside the USA is not feasible for Mudpuppy Games at this time. We know that sucks, but much larger companies with better resources than us have struggled with this and failed. Plus we just can’t bring ourselves to charge shipping costs in excess of the price of the product itself, and for that philosophy we can only apologize in advance.
STRETCH GOALS
There aren’t any! We’re not fooling around here. The entirety of funds raised for this project are being devoted to creating one of the best new gaming zines around. They say “Content is King”, and that axiom is our guiding principle at SCIENTIFIC BARBARIAN.
ADD-ONS
Did you miss out on any of our prior projects? We got you. To add-on any of the following items, just increase your pledge level dollars by the amounts listed below, then when your backer survey comes at the end of the kickstarter note which items you want in the add-on question/text field.
You can add-on any of our last three successful kickstarter projects.
The shipping costs for add-ons depends on how many books you add. Up to three books total (including your print copy of SCIENTIFIC BARBARIAN #1) can be shipped at a combined cost of $5. More than 3 books total have a combined cost of $7. Any reward with multiple books added on will be shipped Media Mail. campaign.story:
“Born in the farlands, she knew only a life of torment and subsistence. Every challenge meaning death, or something worse. It is there she found THE SCRIPTURES OF THE WORM: promising power eternal and the bond of the Grub. She followed them to what we now call her Throne; this stronghold is the only thing between humanity and the scourge of the Doombringer Moth.” -- Some future historian on the God-Queen
RUN! RUN! RUN! (and grab your pig)
What is 2 WORM 2 FURIOUS?
A deadly funnel that revolves around an ever mutating and evolving moth grub. You’ll want 4-6 players, 15-20 level 0 characters, as it’s a funnel, but it works for levels 1+ (the worm adapts; don’t worry). 
THE grub has escaped and you have been charged by the God-Queen to bring it back to the hatchery, but this is a funnel after all… so stuff will inevitably go wrong and will likely be fatal.
The worm grows and grows and grows and grows. The growth unlocks new abilities for the worm grub, ranging from taking a snooze, to spraying caustic acid.
Its mutations don’t stop until it cocoons and becomes the Doombringer Moth. Scales will fall from its hallowed wings, and the god rays will immolate the kingdom.
It will be an A5 Hardcover with Art by Scrap Princess! (over a dozen pieces!). It is currently hovering around 68 pages before layout and final editing.
As a player you’ll be trying to get the Worm / Grub / Juvenile Moth back to the hatchery. You will likely die, be sacrificed to the worm, fall into a sinkhole, or be trampled… because it’s a funnel.
As a Judge you’ll be harnessing the raw power of the grub as it mutates, and changes forms… until it becomes the kingdom shattering Doombringer Moth (unless the players stop it first). You also have access to the royal guard, the knightly orders, the worm-locks and worm-hawks, as well as some encounters.
It is also a setting that you could easily hack this into your own settings and games. Add the worm anywhere, use the God-Queen as an npc, or modify your fighter classes to be like the Knights and Sky Knights. Or just pull out the worm-hawks for use as mounts for your home game.
a quick mockup render via Glynn @ MonkeyBloodDesign
What is Dungeon Crawl Classics?
Dungeon Crawl Classics is a roleplaying game designed and published by Goodman games. It's a combination of classic Appendix N (Conan, Solomon Kane, Lovecraft) goodness, alongside all the things you'd expect in other classic roleplaying games. It has a heavy emphasis on Sword and Sorcery, and you're just as likely to be casting spells and watching your body mutate, as you are to knock a cyclops off a cliff to dam a river. (or in this case, being fed to a burgeoning worm deity)
And even if you don’t play (or own) DCC, it still has HD, and AC and stuff you’d find in other OSR, and D20 systems! (it would also work for a certain fifth edition game; it definitely would) 
the grub that grew up
So what’s inside?
 A Funnel: this is how adventurers are forged. Just bring the grub home, how hard could it be?
 Locations: be it a Tavern, cemetery, farm, or temple.
 Encounters: worm-hawks, rioting villagers, and sinkholes.
 The Worm: how it grows and mutates; acts and reacts. The effects it has on the populace around it.
 New Occupations: barge tenders, swamp witches, scribes, butchers, and more.
New Bestiary Entries
 The Villager: pitchforks and scorn
 Knights of the Forgotten Silk: Warhammer wielding devotees to the grubs; they cast nets to snare their prey. In death they leave a surprise.
 Worm-Locks: guardians of the grub that take vile trophies and read the word of the worm.
 Sky-Knights of the inverted grub: the god-queen’s royal guard; they patrol the skies on their steeds, leaping to the ground to finish whats their javelins don’t.
 Worm-Hawks: ospreys? Pangolins? What are they? Ravenous “birds” with 20 foot wingspans. They feast on worm flesh.
 Bandits & Stilt-Walkers: Need to have something to keep your eye on in the village. Why not a spectacle?
Some important NPCS
 Serena, The God-Queen: SHE who commands this kingdom.
 Eirny Just, Tavern Owner: a retired sky-knight that would rather see the god-Queen dead.
 Pangolust XVIII, ????: worm-hawk breeder that believes herself to be the only one that the god-queen needs.
 Selenium Gellar, “The Jester”: serves as the eyes of the moth-bound; they will rise again.
Moth Clerics or are they Worm-Locks? I don't know
New Patron or Deity?
 Invoke Patron: create dust holograms, make all you gaze upon fall asleep, and harness the god lights.
 Spellburn: runes begin to burn, and your fingers turn to nails.
 Patron Taint: become as a moth, and watch your body deform.
 New Canticles: apply runes to friends as mana batteries and call down sub-orbital lasers.
 New Divine Favors: ever want to cocoon yourself? or sprout wings?
 New Portents of the Worm-God: grubs bursting from the seams, teeth falling out, clouds of moths… you know the usual.
Other Stuff?
Did we say magical rune-marks?
A Worm Tracker (handy reference for the die chain)
Ledgers to keep track of people and kingdoms crushed by the grub-god
We've also tried to add as many tables as possible; as DCC intended.
The Cocoon
Who are we?
Orbital Intelligence is designer, producer, and publisher of tabletop game content, based out of Seattle, WA. Our focus is Zine based releases for the DCC RPG. We have a love for the DIY aspect of Zines, and are excited to be a part of the publisher community for DCC. (We plan to release zines paired with music albums in the future)
Sean Richer is the founder of Orbital Intelligence and the writer of 2 Worm 2 Furious. He grew up playing the Palladium Robotech RPG, and read every Rifts book that he could get his hands on. Sean's been making video games, with a focus on Adventure games, for the last 17 years... and Tabletop Games for the last 3 years.
Recently:
 Terror of the Stratosfiend #2 (DCC / TROIKA!) 
 The Tragedy that Begot Ternwillow (TROIKA!) 
 Necrotic edifices of Iron and Moon; the depth of time untold (TROIKA!)
 Terror of the Stratosfiend #1 (DCC / TROIKA)
 Xorte, a Cyberpunk world full of alien rainbow gods and living mountains. (WeaveRPG)
He enjoys building the lore of these worlds, and is looking forward to sharing "2 WORM 2 FURIOUS" with all of you.

 Writing : Sean Richer (Terror of the Stratosfiend, The Tragedy that begot Ternwillow, Necrotic Edifices of Iron and Moon; the depth of time untold)

campaign.story:
After the tremendous success of The Black Hack Second Edition Kickstarter in 2018, The Black Hack has gone on to become a Mithral Best Seller on DriveThruRPG.com. In addition it also picked up a Silver ENNIE Award for best layout and design in 2019. Now, we're back with a new book: Classic Monsters.
Classic Monsters is designed to support and enhance your Black Hack games. It features over 200 monsters, drawn from B/X and First Edition sources of the The World's Most Popular Fantasy Role Playing Game, all converted for use with The Black Hack. This will allow Black Hack GMs to easily use original or OSR modules in their games without having to convert all of the monsters that they contain. For full list of the monsters that will be included in the book please see Update#2.
Classic Monsters will be published as: a PDF, a 32 (now 40) page soft cover A5 booklet and a 32 (now 40 pages with all unlocked stretch goals) page A5 hard cover book. The book has been designed to be an index for use at the table. Where space in the layout allows, there will be a limited amount of artwork. The layout will be the same style as used in the main rule book. Here's a sample page:
The main text for the book is complete. Upon funding we will finish the layout and then add artwork. We have a few stretch goals planned that would potentially add a few extra pages to the books. These will be written (the drafts are already done) when we hit the goals and we have allowed some time in the schedule for this. A sample PDF of the first few pages is now available as a free download on DriveThruRPG here:
https://www.drivethrurpg.com/product/317836/Classic-Monsters
The Rewards
Level 0 - £1 No reward, but you can follow along and post comments.
Level R - £2 Aimed at retailers/distributors. No reward is included, but we will get in touch in October and give you the option of placing a trade order.
Level 1 - £3 A PDF of Classic Monsters. We will collect email addresses via a survey after the project and distribute vouchers for a free download from DriveThruRPG.
Level 2 - £8 A PDF and a soft cover print copy of Classic Monsters. The print copy will be A5 sized with a 300gsm laminated cover and 170gsm interior pages. Email and mailing addresses will be collected via a survey after the project.
Level 3 - £14 A PDF and a hard cover print copy of Classic Monsters. The hard cover print copy will be A5 sized with a casewrapped board cover and 120 - 170gsm interior pages. Email and mailing addresses will be collected via a survey after the project.
Level 4 - £18 A PDF, a soft cover print copy and a hard cover print copy of Classic Monsters. The soft cover print copy will be A5 sized with a 300gsm laminated cover and 170gsm interior pages. The hard cover print copy will also be A5 sized with a casewrapped board cover and 120 - 170gsm interior pages. Email and mailing addresses will be collected via a survey after the project.
Level 5 - £50 A special limited quantity reward. It includes everything that comes with the Level 4 rewards. PLUS, a Kickster Exclusive hard cover copy of The Black Hack Second Edition main rule book with cloth/silver foil cover and a Black Hack Neoprene Dice Tray. These books were an exclusive item in the last campaign and have never been sold outside of Kickstarter. This is the last chance to get hold of one.
Cloth/Silver Limited Edition Main Rule Book with Dust Jacket
Neoprene Dice Tray
Stretch Goals
Stretch Goal #1 Lost Monsters – 500 Backers UNLOCKED
There are some popular monsters whose names we are not allowed to write in our tome. These monsters have been given new secret names. When we reach 500 backers they will be added as an appendix to Classic Monsters complete with illustrations so that you will be able to recognise them. This goal will add at least 2 pages to both the soft and hard cover editions of the book, and the content will also be included in the PDF. See Update #1 for more details.
Stretch Goal #2 Dinosaurs – 550 Backers UNLOCKED
When we reach this goal entries for 8 popular dinosaurs will be added as an appendix to Classic Monsters. This goal will add at least 1 page to both the soft and hard cover editions of the book, and the content will also be included in the PDF. See Update #2 for more details.
Stretch Goal #3 Poison Tables – 600 Backers UNLOCKED
When we reach this goal tables for poisons will be added as a appendix to Classic Monsters. The tables will cover mild, moderate and severe poisons along with a special Out of Action table for poison victims. This goal will add at least 1 page to both the soft and hard cover editions of the book, and the content will also be included in the PDF. See Update #2 for more details.
Stretch Goal #4 Monster Folio and Spell Index Double Goal - 650 Backers UNLOCKED
When we reach this goal it will unlock 2 great additions to the project.
Spell Index
The Spell Index will include spells from levels 1-10 added as an appendix. The spells will be taken from the existing Arcane spell lists in the main rule book along with a few extra spells that are ideally suited to spellcasting monsters. This goal will add at least 2 pages to both the soft and hard cover editions of the book, and the content will also be included in the PDF.
Monster Folio
This is a printed 16 page booklet for recording details of your own monsters. It will contain a mix of blank templates for recording monster stats and abilities. The inside front and back covers will feature handy reference information taken from the main rule book to assist with the creation of new monsters. All the new pages will be added to the PDF. Level 4 and 5 backers will receive a print copy of the booklet for free as part of their reward. All backers at Levels 2, 3, 4, and 5 may also add copies of the booklet as follows:
1x Print copy of the Monster Folio +£4 including postage anywhere
3x Print copies of the Monster Folio + £8 including postage anywhere
See Update #4 for more details.
Stretch Goal #5 Monster Conversion Rules – 700 Backers UNLOCKED
When we reach this goal rules for converting monsters from B/X and 1st Edition sources will be added as an appendix to Classic Monsters. If space allows we will also include some additional rules to aid GMs in dealing with different types of monsters. This goal will add at least 2 pages to both the soft and hard cover editions of the book, and the content will also be included in the PDF. See Update #5 for more details.
Postage
We are charging for postage within Kickstarter. If you are logged in and click on a reward, it should automatically show you the total with postage to your country before you confirm your pledge. Here are some sample rates for the most common destinations:
Level 2  - UK £2, EU £5, USA £6
Level 3 - UK £2, EU £5, USA £6

Level 5 - UK £5, EU £14, USA £20

Add-ons
The only add-ons available as part of the project are extra print copies of the Classic Monsters book for backers at Level 4 or 5. The rest of The Black Hack range is available to order now from Squarehex.co.uk. In the USA a limited range of Black Hack products are also stocked by: Exalted Funeral, Noble Knight Games, Ettin Games, Rainy Day Games and Games Unlimited. PDF copies of the main rules are available from DriveThruRPG.com.
If you have backed at Level 4 or 5, you may add funds for extra print copies of Classic Monsters with no extra postage to pay.

If you have backed at Level 2,3,4 or 5, you may add funds for extra print copies of the Monster Folio with no extra postage to pay.

Cheers,

campaign.story:
The Precipice of Corruption
Stennard lay in the wooded foothills of a massive impenetrable mountain chain. As far as any of the regional layfolk are concerned, they live on the edge of the world, and all manner of horrors spawn in the shadow of the mountains beyond. There was a time when the people of Stennard may have traveled further west, closer to the rising rock face, but any roads that once were have long since been taken back by nature, with nothing more than deer paths remaining.
The growing season in this region has seen a glut of torrential rains that have damaged and spoiled the crops. This outlier town has few trading partners, and the neighboring towns are suffering the same fate. The townsfolk need to do something to ensure their citizenry have enough in their stores to survive the coming winter. A small band of Stennard’s most prolific hunters and gatherers agreed to press into the forbidden lands to the west and did not return. Desperate, a call was sent out to all of the neighboring towns: “Come to Stennard! We are offering a reward to find our missing sons and daughters.”
Cover layout may differ slightly from what is pictured. Cover art by Matt Stikker.
A 0-Level Funnel for DCC RPG
This dungeon adventure was designed to be run as a 0-level "funnel" for DCC RPG. For those unfamiliar with the concept, each player starts with three or four 0-level peasants who must survive on their wits alone, because they have not yet blossomed into full adventurers with skills and abilities. At the end of the adventure, each player may have one or two survivors who become the adventurers they were destined to be! This adventure plays best with 12-16 0-level characters. (Note: If you play one of the many OSR systems available, you can easily port this over for 5-8 1st level characters.)
The Goal
We feel we are almost ready to send this project to the printer. The writing is just about complete and it could use a couple more passes of editing. We've spent the last two years curating interior art from Rich Sampson (@artofnerdgore), Mike Tommyrot (@miketommyrot), Sam Alcarez (@samalcarez), and cover art from Matt Stikker (@bargainbinblasphemy). We'd like to fill it out with a few more pieces and we'd like to procure higher quality cartography if possible, but most importantly, we'd like to get this adventure into the hands of DCC RPG fans everywhere.
Left to right: Matt Stikker (@bargainbinblasphemy), Sam Alcarez (@samalcarez), Rich Sampson (@artofnerdgore), Mike Tommyrot (@miketommyrot)
Two Years of Play Testing
Over the last two years the adventure has been run over a dozen times across various conventions such as Cyclops Con (2020), Midwinter (2019 & 2020), Dan's Con of the Vale (2019), AdeptiCon (2019) and events additional events at Board Game Barrister and Noble Knight Games (Free RPG Day 2019) by myself and local hero, Jim Meyers. With each play through the content has been tweaked and revised. Though there have been no TPK's (total party kills), the character pool has proven to be suitably funneled down to a handful of characters consistently. 
Additionally, though it plays well in a convention environment, it is an introductory adventure that introduces a number villains who may survive making a great launching point for a campaign.
Adventure Highlights
This adventure has eight named NPCs with stats, descriptions, personality traits, and motivations. The Introductory scene has 20 possible rumors and opinions  for an inquisitive party to gather information from. Split into three acts, the adventure has over 20 potential scenes and encounter areas to explore, combining wilderness set pieces and dungeon encounters.  
Sample images from Rabid Dogs Zine.
The Precipice of Corruption and Rabid Dogs Zine
During Zine Quest 2 we funded Rabid Dogs Zine, a 32 page zine full of rules I use at my own table. Rabid Dogs Zine is a 8.5"x5.5" sized DCC compatible fanzine with a new occupation table, rules for using any traditional character race in combination with any class, two new character classes, the Outlier and the Canine. and for Judges, two Roadside Encounters, with one that is directly connected to the story line of The Precipice of Corruption. 
Why DCC?
I started playing D&D in 1981 with the Tom Moldvay Basic Set and B2 Keep on the Borderlands. I lived and breathed D&D, AD&D, and 2nd Edition AD&D for over a decade, but I discovered miniature wargaming in the mid 90s and somehow I lost interest in RPGs for the next 15 years. Then something happened. I got the itch again for a half dozen people to crowd around a table to share in a story together. I dabbled in Warhammer Fantasy Role-Play, Pathfinder, Call of Cthulhu, and even 5th Edition D&D. None of these systems gave me the experience I was looking for. Enter DCC...
It's 2018 and I discover a system that touted itself as "D&D like it's 1974 again..." and the aesthetic just called out to me. Later that year I was gifted the full rule book and it unlocked the neural pathways I had of memories from when I first fell in love with D&D in 3rd grade. Over the next month I wrote the first draft of this project and ran it for some of my close friends and they seemed to really enjoy it. Bolstered by their enthusiasm, we took it to the streets!
 What is Dungeon Crawl Classics? 
Glory & Gold Won by Sorcery & Sword
You’re no hero.
You’re an adventurer: a reaver, a cutpurse, a heathen-slayer, a tight-lipped warlock guarding long-dead secrets. You seek gold and glory, winning it with sword and spell, caked in the blood and filth of the weak, the dark, the demons, and the vanquished. There are treasures to be won deep underneath, and you shall have them.
Return to the glory days of fantasy with the Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game. Adventure as 1974 intended you to, with modern rules grounded in the origins of sword & sorcery. Fast play, cryptic secrets, and a mysterious past await you: turn the page…
Rules Set: DCC RPG, an OGL system that cross-breeds Appendix N with a streamlined version of 3E.
Support: Goodman Games supports DCC RPG with an extensive line of adventure modules and select other materials.
This product is based upon the Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game, published by Goodman Games. This product is published under license. Dungeon Crawl Classics and DCC RPG are trademarks of Goodman Games. All rights reserved. For additional information, visit www.goodman-games.com or contact info@goodman-games.com

Spawn of Cyclops Con Starts Tomorrow!
Here's a reminder to all of you that Spawn of Cyclops Con starts tomorrow and we still have slots open in 3/4 events. I will be running The Precipice of Corruption both Saturday and Sunday afternoon, and tomorrow I am running two playtest sessions of the one-on-on adventure, The Path of the Valorous. We're Halfway There

It Has Begun!
This week the first batches of The Precipice of Corruption have gone to the post office and are shipping out to you. When your copy ships you will receive a KS message or email notifying you of tracking info. Currently, even though Breaker Press Games is 3 of us, Alex lives in New Jersey and Hal is only in the studio intermittently, so shipping duties are on me for the moment. We're working on streamlining the process, but as of writing this I can squeak out an average of 15 copies a day, which means getting them all out will take a couple of weeks.  Rest assured, we're going to move through these as fast as we can. We're all very excited to get these into your hands ASAP, and hope you gleefully excite and terrify your players with the content within.

Hello All!
This morning Hal, Alex, and I went through the document page by page fixing all of the little weird formatting issues. If you read the document already you may have noticed inconsistencies in what words were capitalized and not capitalized in the stat blocks. Little details like that drive me crazy, so we ironed out the formatting and we changed everything to be visually consistent. A few of you also had noticed a few small typos as well, and we fixed all of those. We are all proud of the finished product and Hal is sending the document to production today. We print here in Milwaukee and the print shop is a mile down the road from my house, so we should have 500 finished books in hand by the end of the week. We will begin shipping immediately, but we can expect the books to go out in waves.

Hello all! I know I said that I'd be sending out Backer Surveys this week, but we were buried in final editing and pushing things around. Hal just dropped what should be the 2nd last version of the book on us. Alex and I will pour over our Asana task list and make sure all of the last round of edits made it into the book. If so, all that remains is to add the compass rose on the wilderness maps and the barcode on the back, and it should be a wrap. I should hopefully send out Backer Surveys in the next day or two. Then we can move onto printing, packing, and shipping these out to all of you, just in time for us to drop our next project during ZineQuest3!

campaign.story:
The cabalistic and powerful Computarchs built the WorldNet, governed its growth, established its laws and conventions, and seemingly retired from their world altering creation. They left their tools and programs scattered throughout the vast network. Some have been found by seekers such as yourself and have been passed down from generation to generation. Collectively these independent pieces of software are known as Enchiridion of the Computarchs. 
K.J. O'Brien
Enchiridion of the Computarchs gives a judge the leg up on developing and using casting mechanics and concepts in high-tech settings. This book encompasses a range of material concerning computers and programs that a “techno-caster” (like the MCC shaman class, or those classes found in Cyber Sprawl Classics, Crawljammer, Umerica, Terror of the Stratosfiend, and Star Crawl) can utilize. Depending on how you want to play DCC RPG Empire of the East or DCC RPG Dying Earth, this book could be used in those settings as well. You will find a collection of spells (aka, programs) in this book, a d24 spellburn table, new mechanics for spell failure, and a brief corruption table all couched in a high-technobabble style for your post-apocalyptic, far-future, and dystopian-future campaigns.
Book Specifications
Officially licensed DCC & MCC third party product.
Pledge rewards are at a discounted price.
8.5" x 11" supplement, ~100 pages, back & white interior, color cover.
Plenty of art. Contributors include: Stefan Poag, David Fisher, Matt Sutton, K.J. O'Brien, Matt Cartwright, and more.
38 Programs, from 1st to 5th level, with a table to roll on.
Mechanics to use programs at your table: burndown (aka spellburn), faults, bugs and critical errors (aka misfire and corruption), and more.
Tables to generate program faults on the fly & create techno acronyms.
Not convinced? Download a free preview from DriveThruRPG and judge for yourself.
Cover by Matt Cartwright
Stretch Goals
As much fun as announcing the attainment of stretch goals is, they can slow down the fulfillment by months. This campaign is going to go very light on stretch goals, because I want to present the complete book rather than dancing around and celebrating stretch goals.
 However, there are some additions to make if we meet certain funding goals:
 $1,500 - If the project funds, I'll open up a crowdsource file for submitting mercurial effects to include in the book. The section will be called Program Provenance and will give a bit of a backstory and mercurial effects to the user's programs. A little taste of the G+ days when we used to set a topic and throw a bunch of ideas in the stew pot. I'll edit and add to the submitted ideas until we have a full list of 80. This idea is subject to participation. If there are none or very few submissions, I may abandon the effort. 
 $5,000 - ICE (Intrusion Countermeasures Electronic) Generator. An additional appendix to help flesh out the monsters and guardians of the meta-verse.
 $6,000 - Kickstarter only printing on 70 lb. paper (standard color in OBS). This option will not be available with the future DriveThruRPG POD release.
Matt Sutton
Project Status
The writing is 100% finished and layout is 90% complete. Artists are being lined-up for commissions and about a third of the art is already done. The focus is on a finished project, rather than a dynamic product based on backer support. This will allow us to get it into your hands fast.
Why?
I've been working on this project on and off since Mutant Crawl Classics RPG came into our lives. I wanted a little something extra for shamans than what was in the book and I figure others might too. Joseph Goodman has been extremely supportive of this project.
That said, most of the programs are re-skins of DCC RPG spells. There are 4 new programs in the book and around 10 of the re-skins were substantial face-lifts. Mechanics borrow from DCC RPG in places, but there is a fair amount of new mechanics and some generation tables. This book is not novel, revolutionary, or even particularly necessary for the DIY judge. Download a free preview from DriveThruRPG and judge for yourself whether the full book will find some use at your table.
I am planning for OBS for printing and fulfillment; that will keep shipping costs down for international backers. Except Canada. Printer for North America is in the USA and you pay first class international. Sorry Canada. I loved the prints from Mixam, but costs are high right now and OBS allows me to offer you the choice between soft and hard cover to control what you can spend.
Since we're not doing a ton of stretch goals and as a way of saying thanks for the early support, Enchiridion of the Computarchs is being offered at a price below the MSRP. So act now and save!
Diogo Nogueira
 What is the Dungeon Crawl Classics RPG? 
Dungeon Crawl Classics (DCC) is a sword & sorcery role-playing game published by Goodman Games. Mechanically, DCC is based on the world’s most popular RPG, but the rules have been reforged—streamlined in some places, expanded in others, and injected with a wild and exciting imagination throughout.  The fantastical imagery and fast playstyle are designed to invoke the classic fantasy and science-fiction adventures tales of old. You’ll find the influences of Leiber, Moorcock, Howard, Vance, Brackett, and more throughout Dungeon Crawl Classics.
What is Mutant Crawl Classics RGP?
Mutant Crawl Classics (MCC) is technology & mutant role-playing game published by Goodman Games. MCC returns players to the early days of sci-fi role-playing and pays homage to Gamma World & Metamorphosis Alpha. The system draws on the innovations that make DCC so popular, including Luck and random effects tables, but offers new races, classes, and artificially intelligent machines and patrons in a post-apocalyptic setting!
Find out more about Dungeon Crawl Classics and Mutant Crawl Classics at www.Goodman-Games.com.
About the Author
James A. Pozenel, Jr. is an OSR gaming hobbyist living in Michigan who loves to write stuff. He is a technical architect by day specializing in API design and has been a software developer and architect for nearly 20 years. You can see some of his other work (The House of the Red Doors, Angels, Daemons & Beings Between Volume 2: Elfland Edition, Fae Hard, Fae Harder: Faerror of the Stratosfiend) on DriveThruRPG and Goodman Games; free stuff in Sanctum Secorum and Gongfarmer's Almanac. He co-wrote The Lesser Key to the Celestial Legion from Psychoda Press and is contributing to The Forgotten Rites of the Moldering Dead. You can send tweets @lectrotext.
The Artists
Craig Brasco is an art professor in Georgia by day and a tabletop RPG nerd by night. He's been playing BX D&D among many other games since 1981. He's been drawing goblins, elves, warriors, etc, for about the same amount of time. You can see more of Craig's art at craigbrasco.com and on Instagram: @orgosan.
Matthew Cartwright is a freelance concept artist and illustrator who works in a variety of styles and mediums. He loves RPGs and is heavily influenced by Miyazaki and Moebius. You can see his art and follow him on Twitter, Instagram and Artstation. ( https://twitter.com/mattthulhu https://www.instagram.com/mattthulhu/ https://www.artstation.com/mattthulhu)
David Fisher lives in the underworld, struggling each day to survive in a land full of snakes, spiders and drop bears. In his primitive environment, David's art has evolved from rudimentary cave paintings to pencils and inks and then finally to the digital realm. His cave wife, Esther and two awesome cave children, Eleora and Gabriel, support David in his quest to further evolve.
Diogo Nogueira is a Brazilian Game Designer and Illustrator. He loves Tabletop RPGs so much he decided to make art for them and even create his own games under the Old Skull Publishing banner!
Stefan Poag lives and works in Michigan with his significant other (Annie) and two dogs.  He draws, paints and sometimes makes mosaics, usually just for his own pleasure but also sometimes for hire.  His illustration work has appeared in publications from Goodman Games, Kenzer & Company, Game Developer and others.
Matt Sutton has been producing traditional ink illustrations and digital art for fanzines and small projects for years. He lives with his wife Julie on their family farm in Indiana. After founding a few successful businesses, Matt and Julie are happy to have freedom to focus on creating art for themselves and projects that interest them. You can find more of their art @misinkthrope and @suttonsburrow
Del Teigeler is a native of the great lakes state, he has been drawing creatures and heroes for as long as he can remember. Voted most likely to succeed in art at an early age he has been striving to accomplish that lofty goal, unfortunately his love for creating monsters and warriors for role-playing games has prevented him from hitting the big-time. He began professional illustration on a part time basis in 2014 and has enjoyed where his art has taken him. He looks forward to creating more imagery for his favorite hobby.
Plus: Acid Lich, Sinereous, and more!

updates.update_userinfo: The Tales of the Computarch Continue
updates.update_content:
Hi all,
February is time for ZineQuest! 
Donn Stroud and myself have a Kickstarter with your choice of 3 zines! 2 of the 3 three feature MCC/DCC RPGs and Computarchs content! I hinted at some Patron AIs at the conclusion of Enchiridion and they are coming to pass during this ZineQuest campaign!

It's Over
That's it folks! All the books are ordered and winding their way from DTRPG, to the Lightning Source (the printer), to your friendly neighborhood postal system, and ultimately to YOU! 
I just want to send a final thanks to all the artists who helped bring the book to life and all the editors who helped me correct the mistakes. Lastly I want to thank you for backing the project.

Ok this is it! I’m ordering today and tomorrow. I assume you’ll get an email with some sort of indication that an order has been created for you (I could be wrong).   
Like I said yesterday DTRPG's US printer has been particularly slow due to COVID. It has taken 5-10 days just to print. Expect another week or more for the USPS to get the packages to you. 
I have no idea what Europe & Australia’s mail times are. I assume about the same or faster in Europe. Australia destination books will mail from the UK as usual with whatever delay that is.
They have finally arrived!  I'm ready to get this book in your hands. Turn around times for DriveThruRPG has been about a 5 to 10 days. You all should start seeing this land on your doorstep soon!

Good news, everyone: I've finished my edits and updated the DriveThruRPG PDF.  Enchiridion of the Computarchs is now released it to the public! Thanks for pledging to make the book a reality! You did it! 
Everyone ought to have complimentary copy notices in the e-mail from way back in August. Can't find it? Ping me --either here or at lectrotext@gmail.com -- and I'll resend.
I've uploaded the files for the soft and hard cover versions of the book. I'm waiting to hear if they pass muster with the printers. After that happens, I'll be ordering my proofs.

It's been awhile, and I've been awfully busy. Lots of home life activities (school, vacations, and birthdays) and Donn Stroud asked me to assist with editing on  The Forgotten Rites of the Moldering Dead.
I've gotten back the final pieces of art, everything is laid out, and I'm making my own final editing pass through the book. That should be finished within a week or so. Then ordering the proofs from DriveThruRPG and waiting for them to come back. I haven't heard back from anyone regarding typos or other issues, so I guess that's a good sign. If you find anything, please let me know with an e-mail to lectrotext@gmail.com.

Art and Artists
I want to take a moment to talk about all the artists who have contributed to the book. There's 15(!) of them so I'm not going to talk about each one individually, but as a group or, I guess, in groups. 
Many of the names are familiar to DCC RPG folks. David Fisher, Stefan Poag, Bradely K. McDevitt, Diogo Nogueira, Carmin Vance, Del Teigeler, KJ O’Brien, Matt Sutton are long time contributors to the DCC RPG community. Whether they do 3rd party or GFA or Goodman Games official they are great assets to tap for projects and turn out stellar work. I want to give my thanks to them all. I hit up Carmin for the ICE Generator stretch goal and I'm delighted to share one of the pieces right now:

I escaped this past week for a little family holiday in the Upper Peninsula (Michigan). I did get to have a look at the Program Provenance as promised. There appears to be enough support for the crowdsourcing that throwing it out is not an option. Eight backers threw lots cool ideas into the pot! I did some editing, threw in some more of my own, scoured the DCC RPG rulebook for more. There is still room for more ideas and suggestions (24 to be exact). I call on you all to have a look and come up with some additional mercurial effects for the book. You will go down in history, joining the other illustrious eight, as contributors to Program Provenance.

campaign.story:
Unfamiliar is a complete adventure campaign for Dungeons & Dragons 5th edition. Thanks to its unique encounter system featuring exponential growth, it's suitable for player characters of any level. The story allows you to explore a new setting (the land of Valdir), inhabited by variety of original creatures and obstacles for the players to overcome. The book itself (a tome of more than 350 pages long, illustrated in full color) contains the sandboxy campaign, but also a complete bestiary (including printable monster tokens) and an overview of the setting - but rather than reading about the setting, I want you to experience it first-hand! This can only be accomplished by playing through the campaign and uncovering the secrets of Valdir as you go along.
Up until a century ago, the land of Valdir was inhabited by humans, ruled by four powerful wizards. Then one night, all human life vanished from the face of Valdir without a trace. To this day, no one knows what happened or what made them abandom the world they built, but it was the wizards' servants who were left behind to fend for themselves. Four species of familiar -beasts, undead, constructs and fey- inherited the ruins of Valdir's once-great civilization. New strife erupted to fill the power gap the wizards had left in their absence, and several powerful factions emerged among their former familiars. When a summoning ritual goes awry, an external influence is unleashed upon Valdir for the first time in a hundred years, in the form of the player characters. They will have to navigate ancient ruins and enchanted locations as well as the political battlefield to eventually decide the fate of Valdir in this open-ended story that goes beyond good and evil. YOUR choices will have a lasting impact on the future of Valdir!
Unfamiliar isn't just a setting, a bestiary or a set of adventure hooks. It's a complete adventure campaign set in an original world with an alien look and feel, unlike anything you've ever encountered before. The book is divided into fourteen chapters, each a complete adventure module in itself based on locations in Valdir. The player characters choose where they'll go while exploring the strange lands surrounding them, and depending on where their trail  leads them, you simply run the appropriate chapter. The chapters are interlinked by four possible metaplots that make up the overarching story and reach their conclusion in one of four different endings; it's up to the players to decide which route their characters take, which bait to take, and which alliances to form in order to get the upper hand and create their very own custom-built story as they go along.
Apart from that, this game utilizes a unique system of exponentional growth where encounters are concerned. Instead of going where the level-appropriate monsters are, encounter difficulty will adapt to match the experience level of your party. As such, this campaign is playable with characters of any level. You have that one character you've been aching to play again appear in Valdir, or start anew with a party of level-one characters. Anything is possible as the story adapts itself to your needs!

What happened to the humans of Valdir? How will the different species of familiar react to the changes the players bring?  Will the PCs step forward as noble freedom-fighters or as opportunists who ally themselves with the most powerful faction? Or maybe they just want to get back home? Anything is possible in this huge adventure campaign that'll have you plotting and scheming as well as exploring and uncovering secrets for years on end. But don't take my word for it - here's an excerpt from the book's introduction to give you some more information on what it's all about:  Unfamiliar.pdf 
In exchange for your generous pledge, you'll get a full-color, beautifully illustrated, hardcover book, more than 350 pages long. The adventure campaign within should have you exploring the land of Valdir for years on end! You'll also get a set of printable monster tokens, as the creatures of this mythic land differ significantly from what you're used to. And did I mention that shipping is absolutely free worldwide?

...And as we're feeling exceptionally charitable today, 5 % of all the funds raised by this Kickstarter campaign will go to Castle Critical, a non-profit organisation here in Belgium that brings role-playing games to children's hospitals. Voluntary dungeon masters set out to play games with hospitalized kids on a regular basis to make their stay more comfortable and, of course, provide an escape from harsh reality at a time when they need it most. Links to their social media below!
https://www.facebook.com/castle.critical/
https://www.instagram.com/castle.critical/

updates.update_content:
Hi all!

It's been a while since the last update, so I thought I'd tell you a little about the progress I've been making with "Unfamiliar". First off, I've been quite busy writing and designing! The most time-consuming part of the campaign right now is creating the maps. I'm using Dungeonfog for it, which works great, but I've noticed it takes a long time to design a map! I can easily write a couple of pages a day, but designing a detailed, single-page map takes about a week. Now I do want to make them detailed enough so you've got a clear visual reference for the room descriptions I'm putting out there (the lazy readers among you will understand!), but it's taking somewhat longer than I've been expecting. For me personally, quality is more important than quantity, and that's something I'm willing to put more hours of work in if necessary.

Hi everybody!
I just wanted to post another update as -let's have the bad news first- I've come to the conclusion that an April launch will sadly not be possible. There's several reasons for this, obviously everything going on around Covid-19 is a big one, but my own recent bouts with mental health issues have been causing delays as well. I would like to apologize to all you loyal backers for this, as I don't like to come back on a promise, but they're simply strange times we live in I'm afraid...
Of course, a Kickstarter campaign actually sending out rewards at the time planned is more of a flight of fantasy than the greatest dragon-ridden dungeon any of us can come up with. Right now, I'm aiming to get the PDFs done by summer, and get the physical books printed somewhere after that. I think I do owe you guys an update about how it's all going to look, so here's a preview of the art for the GM screen I've been working on; each of the four panels represent one of Valdir's wizards and the species of familiar they created...

Yes, I am that pathetic that I don't have anything better to do on Valentine's day than post an update! (Just kidding, it's actually my tenth wedding anniversary in two weeks, so we just don't really do Valentine's here ;) )
Anywho, this Kickstarter campaign started off with the idea of using DriveThruRPG as a partner for fulfilment. Now with Brexit in effect, there's been some concerns here on mainland Europe that this would mean extra costs (right now, VAT, but that can change too) being charged to the end user. As I wanted to avoid that (free shipping also means no extra costs in my book!), I've now partnered with a local distributor (Hydra Games) for printing and distribution. The books are to be printed here in Europe and from the samples I've seen, the print quality is even better than what DriveThruRPG has to offer, so it seems like a win-win situation!

Hi all!
First of all, my best wishes for 2021. I hope everybody's safe and healthy, and that we'll all be able to get more people around the gaming table in person this year (online is fine, but those glitchy apps are getting on my nerves ;) ).
I'd also like to present you with a little "Unfamiliar"-based side project I've been working on. I'm proud to present "A nightmare in porcelain", a horror-themed adventure for three to five first-level characters that can be used as a precursor for the "Unfamiliar" campaign or as a stand-alone adventure on which you can base a homebrew campaign. It can easily be adapted to any existing campaign setting. This module introduces several of the creatures and strange things that will also show up in "Unfamiliar", so it's certainly a taste of things to come!

updates.update_userinfo: Presenting the new map of Valdir!
updates.update_content:
Hi all!
I know what you're thinking - it's been a while without any updates, and now we're getting two at once? Don't worry, I'm not going to be spamming you, it's just that I actually have something to share this time! I've just received the new artworkI've had comissioned for the map of Valdir. I received a lot of feedback during the campaign that my own attempt at map-making was a bit shoddy at best (I'm more of a writer than a graphic designer, I'm afraid) so I've commissioned a local artist to draw me up a better one.

Hi all!
several of you have been poking me for updates, and you're absolutely right - one is quite overdue. The reason that I've been a bit quiet lately is actually, there's not really anything to report. I wanted to send an update as soon as I've got something to share with you, but for now, things are just progressing. 
I'm mostly writing and doing a new round of playtesting (mostly to get encounters balanced), but I'm afraid it isn't very thrilling news. New art is commissioned for the map of Valdir, but that's a work in progress as well. So I'm afraid there's no real news; if I was making leaps of progress all of a sudden, or was panicking because things are slowing down, it would be more exciting - but just being on schedule is a bit boring, I'm afraid ;)

Hi all!
I thought it might be time for a little update on the progress I'm making with "Unfamiliar". Right now, the first four chapters of the book are nearly completely finished (i.e. ready for print). That leaves ten more to go, but take in mind that the first chapter (the introduction) is the size of about five "normal" chapters in itself (it includes a plot overview, but also a complete bestiary of all creatures you might encounter in Valdir, for example).

Hi all!
Here's a little update on what I've been up to the last month... Well, it's hot over here. Really hot. Searing hot! But in between ongoing quarantine and several heat waves, I have been able to continue work on "Unfamiliar". I've mostly been busy writing the actual book, along with playtesting. As personal contact with strangers isn't such a good idea under present circumstances, I've been using my own family as test subjects and it's going great! My seven-year-old daughter is particularly excited about the storyline, so that's looking good :)

updates.update_userinfo: A little update about the good you've done!
updates.update_content:
Hi all!
I've been in talks with Castle Critical, the non-profit organisation we're supporting. As 5 % of your pledge goes straight to them, it's great to hear the good they're doing with those funds!
Castle Critical brings role-playing games to children who have been hospitalized, but due to the current epidemic that's affecting all of us, it is of course impossible to play with them in person: hospitals are rigorously quarantined right now, and only vital personnel is admitted. That's why the organisation has been looking for online solutions to get the kids gaming anyway!

So, the Kickstarter campaign has just ended and it's generated more interest than I ever dared to dream! Ending at nearly 1000 % funded is something I never thought would happen, and it's only thanks to you that this is now possible. You're all awesome, thank you so much!
Now, the next step is of course to make sure you get the best possible quality for your rewards. Bringing you an original game, both in content and in gameplay, was my goal all along - but also to make it affordable for people all over the world, regardless of where you live. And I'll continue working on making that a reality for all of you! I'll send you updates the next couple of months on how the writing and lay-outing is going, and when that's all done, it's time to start the proofreading process. Luckily, I've got some tried and tested proofreaders here that work both quickly and with great care, so I'm sure I'll be able to get the complete product out to you by early next year, as promised!

campaign.story:
Help build an awesome book of twenty boss battles and climactic encounters for your D&D games.
The best 5e fantasy roleplaying games are often the most unpredictable. When the plans of the Gamemaster meet the actions of the characters, the incredible creative energy that results can spin encounters off in different directions, creating a largely spontaneous campaign story that keeps the GM and the players alike on the edge of their seats. But when it comes to the climactic boss battle encounters that cap off single adventures or entire campaigns, it’s often much harder for GMs to work things out on the fly.
That’s where this book comes in. 
Fantastic Lairs cover art by Jack Kaiser
Scott Gray, James Introcaso, and Mike Shea have teamed up to lighten the load of shaping and developing your game’s climactic encounters. Fantastic Lairs is a book of capstone lair encounters for your 5e fantasy RPG, designed to inspire and fit into your own campaign. Each fantastic lair includes evocative artwork, a beautiful full-color map, and a well-designed and playtested boss encounter for characters of various levels.
Check out the free sample, which includes two fantastic lairs you can use right now! We're also releasing virtual tabletop-ready maps for these two lairs so you can run them easily online.
The initial campaign goal for this book includes lairs for 1st- through 10th-level characters, each of which includes instructions for scaling it for different levels of play. After breaking through five stretch goals, we will now add lairs for 11th- through 20th-level play. The book will now include twenty lairs for all four tiers of play. 
Fantastic Lairs is the joint brainchild of all three members of the design team, each of whom brings a wealth of creative skill and experience to the project. From over fifty initial concepts, the team narrowed down a selection of twenty ultimate boss lairs for development in this book.
Your support for this project will fund the design, development, editing, artwork, and cartography that will make this book a reality. The more support we receive, the better the book will be. 
Internal view of Caves of the Cockatrice (Illustration by Allie Briggs)
The Lairs
Thanks to our backers' outstanding support we will have the following twenty lairs in this book.
Lair of the Cockatrice (1st Level). A shadow-infused cockatrice keeps a stone garden in a lair built around an ancient and corrupted fey gateway.
Centipede Cultists (Tier 1). A band of centipede-worshipping cultists feed living sacrifices to their pets in a fallen temple of Asmodeus.
Nevermind (Tier 1). The Dead Roses, a band of cutthroats led by the murderous bandit captain Adilia Rose, hide out between jobs in a seedy tavern built from a titan's skull.
Lord Whiskers (Tier 1). A band of wererats led by the megalomaniacal Lord Whiskers gathers up all the city's silver to be destroyed in their trap-infested sewer lair.
Nature's Rage (Tier 1). A blood-drenched druid and a horde of beasts plot revenge against the despoilers of nature in the ruined zoo of a murdered noble.
The Fiery Belly of the Beast (Tier 2). The half-dragon Tharandra Everflame and her kobold minions steer a machine of war and fire through defenseless villages.
The Lamia Job (Tier 2). The characters must infiltrate a mysterious bank vault to reveal the murderous plots and corrupting illusions of a lamia mastermind.
The Blood Palace (Tier 2). In a lost ziggurat of blood, a sinister spirit naga and its enthralled gnolls need the adventurers' help — to feed their hidden hydra.
Sticky Toffee (Tier 2). The confections at Auntie Bea's Sweet Treats are more than they seem — as is the shop's night hag proprietor.
Those Who Are About to Die (Tier 2). The characters face waves of brutal combatants and devastating hazards in this arena of blood, death, and fire.
Bumpy Ride (Tier 2). A mage uses his airship and an array of deadly incendiary devices to terrorize other wizards into subservience, and the characters must put an end to it.
Deadtention (Tier 2). An oni poses as the kindly headmaster of an academy for young sorcerers, where he uses a dark ritual to sacrifice faculty members and increase his power.
Ithrix Blackblood (Tier 2). A young black dragon uses his acidic breath to keep a band of trolls under his sway in an ancient cyclopean ruin.
The Blue Dragon Spellthief (Tier 3). The characters pursue a blue dragon mage set on robbing an arcane vault filled with volatile magical artifacts.
The Blade Queen's Throne (Tier 3). The characters must retrieve a secret word required to save the world — but that word is protected by a powerful marilith for its demon lord master.
Tomb of the Dragonlords (Tier 3). In the desert tomb of an ancient dragon queen, a dragonborn mummy lord guards a magical jewel that might destroy the world.
Blood Rain (Tier 3). A cloud giant vampire moves across the sky in a red cloud castle defended by monstrous thralls and vampire spawn, raining blood upon the land that raises ghouls in its wake.
The Lich's Sanctum (Tier 4). In an astral sanctum that defies natural physics, the characters battle an ancient lich responsible for the deaths of nine worlds.
Put the Monster Back (Tier 4). The tarrasque breaks free of a secure facility designed to hold the worst monsters of creation, and will tear through the walls of reality, devouring entire worlds unless the characters stop it.
Blood and Gold (Tier 4). In a shattered celestial temple, an ancient gold dragon is possessed by a demon prince encased in a spike buried in the dragon's chest, and threatens the mystical pillar that holds the multiverse together.
 (Many of these lair names are placeholders for now, and are likely to change.)
Surprise-dra! (Illustration by Jack Kaiser)
Art Book. Every backer will receive the digital version of the Fantastic Lairs Art Book, containing the art and maps for each lair, suitable for showing to your players. Those backing the print-option tier will also have the option to buy a physical art book at the cost of printing and shipping.
Reward Tiers
We have two simple reward tiers for this project: the $15 digital tier and the $20 physical tier. The physical tier will give you the ability to buy print-on-demand copies of the book and any print-based stretch goals at the cost of printing and shipping, fulfilled by DriveThruRPG.
Stretch Goals
We have already broken through ten stretch goals adding ten lairs, a monster appendix, and an art book for all backers. We have also unlocked a hardcover option for all print-on-demand backers. (Backers of the $20 print-on-demand option tier will be able to order either softcover or hardcover versions of the book at the cost of printing and shipping.) We have more stretch goals coming in the future.
We’re also going to put together adventure outlines that we’ll be releasing to all backers as a digital-download PDF supplement to Fantastic Lairs. Each of these adventure outlines will provide DMs with the narrative bare bones of a potential adventure arc — or even a full campaign — linking and leading into some of our own favorite fantastic lairs from the book. Each outline is like a summary that you can use as a starting point and narrative guideline to build a full adventure or campaign, highlighting potential plot points, cool backstories, great locations, exciting encounters, memorable NPCs and monsters, and more.
These outlines will be written by TK Johnson, LaTia Jacquise, Lysa Penrose, Jen Vaughn, Leon Barillaro, Willy Abeel, Casey Machado, Collette Quach, Rich Lescouflair, and Jess Ross.
We're also adding THREE final, special boss lairs based on suggestions given to us by backers. Voting in the backers-only poll is now live and will end at the same time as the Kickstarter!
The Physical Tier and Print-on-Demand
As we have in other projects, this project will deliver physical rewards as print-on-demand books from DriveThruRPG. You will be responsible for the costs of printing and shipping once the books are done. Both printing and shipping costs vary depending on the size of the book and any increases in costs from the printers, but they are usually very reasonable (roughly $11 for the softcover and $23 for the hardcover + shipping).
Delivering books through a print-on-demand publisher helps us keep the costs down as much as possible. It's the most efficient way to get this physical book into your hands.

campaign.story:
Folk Magic of the Haven Isles is a role-playing supplement for old school role-playing games. Its focus is on magicians, wizards and magic-users. The book is written for Swords & Wizardry and therefore can be used in all retro-clones and old school role-playing games with little or no work.
But I don't have or play any old school role-playing games. Is it still useful?
Absolutely. It is intended for any fantasy role-playing games to inspire and provide ideas for players and Game Masters alike. If you know what HD and Saving Throws are, you will be easily able to understand and adapt most of the rules-related content in this book.
If you know anything about The Midderlands fantasy setting, you will see information within the book that makes it directly usable with The Midderlands setting. It is 100% compatible.
If not, don't worry! You don't need to know anything. There is a glossary that explains what any unfamiliar (mainly geographical) words/terms are. In your own setting, you can just swap out place names.
An A5-sized (148mm wide x 210mm high OR Approx. 5.8" wide x 8.3" high) containing 60 interior pages comprising 19 pages of evocative, full colour illustrations.
 14 Magic-User sub-classes, such as the Peller, Hermetic Magician, Demon Slave, Toadman, Spae Wife, Stitch Witch, Green Child, and Apple Queen/King. These sub-classes are 'overlays' that are intended to be used in conjunction with the magic-user class, giving them benefits, drawbacks and flavour.
 16 Magic-User backgrounds such as the Arcane Gloombugger, Cultist, Goblin Stinkbinder, and Stone Tender. Unique and flavourful micro-stories that make your magician unique and explain how they came to practice magic.
 7 Tomes (spellbook ideas) such as the Little Key of the Whole Art of Hydromancy. Ideas for spellbooks that can be the goals of magician's quests.
 16 Magical Spells such as Gloomray, Transmute Lead into Gold, Enforce Queueing, and more. Usable in any old school game.
 4 Oddities of the Haven Isles. Unusual objects, flora, and fauna such as the Mandrake and Wizard Hole.

campaign.story:
Cat’s Cradle stands at the intersection of a caravan and river route, which brings in mysterious travelers, unscrupulous grifters, and -- quite often -- dangerous villains. The Kickstarter includes a town sourcebook for Cat's Cradle, the adventure Eye of Itral, and Fortune Hunters, a book of town-oriented NPCs. This Kickstarter is a bit different from our normal approach -- see "PPA Loan and COVID-19" below.
A Place of Dangers and Opportunities
A walled town of roughly 4000 citizens, Cat's Cradle is a modular resource that can be used any time you need a town at the intersection of trade routes. In the world of the Lost Lands it is located in the Duchy of Saxe, at the intersection of the Gap Road and the Hyon River. This puts the town conveniently close to the Necromancer Games adventure Trouble at Durbenford. The primary focus of this 3-book set, though, is to fill in the gap when you need a relatively detailed town on short notice.
What’s in Cat’s Cradle?
Cat's Cradle Sourcebook: A 44-page sourcebook on the shops, industries, factions, and mysteries of Cat’s Cradle. This book is system neutral.
The Eye of Itral: A 44-page “fantasy noir” adventure in Cat’s Cradle written by Ken Spencer. Available for 5th Edition, Swords & Wizardry, and Pathfinder 1e.
Fortune Hunters: A plethora of NPCs who live in and drift through the town. Available for 5th Edition, Swords & Wizardry, and Pathfinder 1e. 44 pages.
All three of the books are premium-quality paper, saddle-stitched, and printed in the USA.
PPA Loan and COVID-19
We’re using the proceeds of a PPA loan to employ our writers and artists on an immediate basis, which lets us keep paying them at normal levels despite a bad market. For this reason, we’re following the unusual procedure of offering a Kickstarter before the work itself is completed. The books will be printed at the Arizona printshop we use for Indiegogo projects rather than in China, which allows us a much faster turnaround to backers. Most of the initial legwork has already been done, and the project should be almost completed by the time the Kickstarter ends, with the exception of layout and some of the art orders. To the extent the Kickstarter generates any profit — which isn’t guaranteed in this market — we will continue turning the profit around to new projects, to generate as steady a stream of work-flow as we can.
The Books
  The Cat's Cradle Sourcebook describes the important locations in the town and its immediate surroundings, such as the "salt" mines formed by the ancient intersection of some massive interplanar beast with the material plane. The otherworldly mineral deposits left behind are used in Cat's Cradle's thriving alchemy-related businesses.
 The Eye of Itral is a "film noir" type adventure set in Cat's Cradle, written by Ken Spencer. Mysteries and secrets abound, and some of them can be very, very dangerous...
 Fortune Hunters is a book of non-player characters that may be encountered in town. Each of the NPCs is detailed at three different points in their history: low level, medium level, and high level. They can be used as recurring allies or villains with ready explanations of what they have been doing since the last time the characters encountered them.
Stretch Goals
Our Stretch Goals for this Kickstarter are parts of the Waypoints series written by Mike "Sieg" Stewart. 
Adventure is what your players crave. They seek fortune around every corner. Alas, glory is often found in remote locales that require a perilous journey before they can even begin their quest. Expeditions do not happen instantly, and the journey can be an adventure all its own. What will they find? Where will they stay? Where can they get a drink on the way? Waypoints is a series of digital releases focused on individual places that range from key locations such as a temple within a city to a secluded inn at the edge of civilization, its lonely hall only nominally a subject to any faraway king. The Waypoints series will highlight a single business, public building, or other more fantastical point of interest and is designed to be a creative interlude for everything from rest to rescue. All the mechanics within the text are general and designed to apply to any popular tabletop roleplaying game system.

[LOCKED] $30,000 Waypoints: The Gaol (PDF)
Shipping
Digital Reward Shipping
You will be receiving a kickstarter survey to finalize your address and contact information. We will email the instructions to groups of eligible backers with instructions on how to access PDF pledge rewards. This is a three-step process that is completed using our web store. You will have to create a customer account on the Frog God Games website to get your PDF; it's how we keep track of everything. The Kickstarter PDF files are 'purchased' at zero cost by backers (as they are paid for after the Kickstarter) at the Frog God Games web store using a coupon code. That code will be sent via email to backers at the email address provided in the Kickstarter survey. This process gets you your correct reward, ensures your future access to your reward files, and allows us to track project fulfillment. If you are missing something from your account, and see all over Facebook that everyone else has it, please email Mike at mike@froggodgames.com, and he will set things right for you. Be patient for a few days after it is first released though, as we do release these in batches to prevent crashing our server.
Physical Reward Shipping
 Your Kickstarter pledge amount does not include shipping.
You will be receiving a kickstarter survey to finalize your address and contact information. The first step toward getting your softcover set(s) to you. The second step, once the rewards are ready to ship, will be detailed in an email. This email will contain instructions to complete your reward selection and pay for it to be shipped to you. This step is also where your system selection(s) of 5e, S&W, or PFRPG takes place. This will be done using the Frog God website.
Shipping Damage or other Related Issues
No matter what we do, the post office seems to have a desire to drop, kick, throw or even drive over some packages with trucks (yes, it has happened). In the unlikely event that you are one of the lucky folks that have this happen to you, we will of course send you a new book. All you need to do is send photos of the damage in an email to Mike at mike@froggodgames.com. He will set you up with a new book. Please do not send multiple emails to multiple sources as it confuses the process and may cause delay. That being said, we have a 100% delivery promise on our books. You are the reason we are able to make cool products, and your satisfaction matters to us.
Refunds
If for some reason you need a refund post-Kickstarter, we are happy to oblige, less a 13% charge that we pay to Kickstarter and Paypal.

Unlike most of our Kickstarters, this one is being produced in real-time rather than before launch in order to provide an income stream to creators from our PPA loan. We estimate that the writing will be completed before the Kickstarter ends, but the project carries the risks associated with projects that launch before substantial completion.
Frog God Games has been in business since 2010, and has fulfilled numerous (27!) Kickstarter projects. As with any crowdfunding program, the time-lapse between payment and delivery of a final product is subject to various risks, including the failure of a supplier, damage in shipment, disruptions within a company, and changes in the prices of materials and shipping. Experience gained over a number of projects makes us confident that we have contingency plans for the ordinary, foreseeable issues that might arise.
